title: mori_ougai_(bungou_stray_dogs)
body:
A [[Bungou Stray Dogs]] character, based off the real-life poet/[[Imperial Japanese Army]] surgeon Ougai Mori (1862-1922). The leader of the Port Mafia in the series. 

He is portrayed with [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]]. His outfit consists of a [[black coat]] worn with a [[black vest]], [[white shirt]], [[white necktie]], [[red scarf]], [[black pants]], and [[black boots]]. Normally paired with [[Elise (bungou stray dogs)|]] and uses a [[scalpel]] as a weapon. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: LtGen. Ougai Mori":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mori_%C5%8Cgai]

title: misumi_uika
body:
Character from [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]], guitarist and vocalist of [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]] and [[Sumimi (bang dream!)|]].

She performs for [[Ave Mujica (bang dream!)|]] under the pseudonym [[Doloris (bang dream!)|]].

She is voiced by [[Sasaki Rico (voice actor)|]].

Episode 11 of [i]Ave Mujica[/i] reveals that [spoilers]she has been impersonating [[Misumi Uika's sister|her half-sister]], that her actual name is [i]Misumi Hatsune[/i], and that her father is [[Togawa Sadaharu]]. This technically makes any [[yuri]] between her and [[Togawa Sakiko]] [[incest]], but for practical reasons (see topic #31057) this should only be tagged when the art in question references this secret relationship. When their aunt-niece relationship or Hatsune's real identity is specifically referenced, it should be tagged as [[spoilers]].[/spoilers]

h4. Appearances
* !post #8506661: Casual
* !post #7238599: [[Sumimi (bang dream!)|]]
* !post #8506662: [[Doloris (bang dream!)|]]
* !post #8655568: [[Doloris (bang dream!)|]][br]Ave Mujica anime

title: yamato_(one_piece)
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Daughter of [[Kaidou (one piece)|]], albeit identify herself as a "man" and referring to herself as "Oden" [spoiler]due to her encounter with [[Kouzuki Oden]] leaving such a strong impression on her that she wanted to become a "man" to leave Wano and undertake an adventure like him, and she began to imitate his mannerisms as a result[/spoiler].

Like her father, Yamato has inherited the dragon blood and as such she is [[tall female|significantly taller than an average woman]], standing at 263 cm.

Having consumed the Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Okuchi no Makami [[Devil Fruit]], she can transform into a divine [[wolf]] and is capable of freezing things around her.

title: star_wars
body:
An epic American space opera franchise created by filmmaker [[George Lucas]], originally produced by Lucasfilms before [[Disney]] later acquired the rights in 2012. It is a [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] story set in a faraway galaxy. Chronicling the galactic-scale conflict primarily involves the benevolent [[Jedi]] and the evil [[Sith]] faction.

The Star Wars saga has had a significant impact on popular culture; is one of the highest-grossing media franchises of all time. Because of its huge success across the world during the late 70s, several media including Japanese anime and manga from that era were heavily inspired by it.

title: jedi
body:
[quote][i]There is no emotion, there is peace.
There is no ignorance, there is knowledge.
There is no passion, there is serenity.
There is no chaos, there is harmony.
There is no death, there is the Force.[/i] - The Jedi Code.[/quote]

A fictional group from the [[Star Wars]] universe.

The honorable members of the [b]Jedi Order[/b] have been the keepers of peace and justice in the [[galaxy]] for millenia. 

Despite the pacifist nature of the order the Jedi knights are powerful and brave warriors, but they only use combat as a last resort to solve conflicts. The Jedi value the life and freedom of any living beings above anything else.

Their weapon of choice is the [[lightsaber]], an elegant weapon from a more civilized age. Jedi lightsaber colors vary and can be either white, yellow, blue, green, purple, pink, orange, etc.

title: mobile_armor
body:
A type of [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series, mobile armors are typically massive, heavily destructive, usually non-humanoid units that dwarf the average [[mobile suit]]. While generally much more sluggish than mobile suit, they are typically designed as a weapon of mass destruction (often housing a single mega beam particle cannon in its center), with some even capable of defeating an entire spaceship fleet on its own.

The term is also sometimes used to refer to the alternate forms of certain transforming mobile suits, including the [[Baund Doc]] and [[Methuss]].

Mobile armors are depicted fairly consistently throughout the franchise's AU series. The only major exception to this is [[Gundam SEED]], in which the majority of the mobile armors seen are more akin to [[starfighter|starfighters]].

h4. Examples
* [[Adzam]]
* [[Apsalus]]
** [[Apsalus II]]
* [[Bigro]]
* [[Big Zam]]
** [[Byg-Zamuru]]
* [[Elmeth]]
* [[Hashmal (mobile armor)|]]
* [[Neue Ziel]]
* [[Rafflesia (gundam)|]]
* [[Zakrello]]
* [[Zeong]]
** [[Neo Zeong]]
*** [[II Neo Zeong]]
** [[Perfect Zeong]]

title: zakrello
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime series from 1979. 

[b]MA-04X Zakrello[/b]
 
One of the earliest [[mobile armor]]s fielded by the Principality of [[Zeon]] during The One Year War, the Zakrellos straight-line speed was tremendous buts its agility suffered due to lack of verniers.

Its design is unique among the other Zeon mechas, as it features a monster-like face (designed for psychological warfare) instead of the distinctive monoeye commonly found on Zeon mechas and is yellow instead of green. It was armed with a scattering mega-particle gun, twin heat "Nata" weapons for close combat, and 4-tube missile launchers.

title: kou_uraki
body:
A fictional main character from the [[Gundam]] series.

He first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991,

[b]Kou Uraki[/b] is a young [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] test [[pilot]] [spoiler]involved in the tragic events that led to the creation of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]][/spoiler].

His mecha of choice are the [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]], the [[Gundam GP-01 Full Vernian Zephyranthes]] and the [[Gundam GP-03 Stamen]].

title: dendrobium_schema

[[Gundam GP-03 Stamen]] is the mobile suit that docks with the Orchis unit and in actual depictions it should be tagged.

title: gundam_gp-01_zephyranthes
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]RX-78GP01 Gundam Zephyrantes[/b] 

An experimental upgraded version of the [[RX-78-2 Gundam]], built by [[Anaheim Electronics]]. It was briefly piloted by [[Kou Uraki]], and upgraded to the much more maneuverable [[Gundam GP-01 Full Vernian Zephyranthes]] after the original spec was damaged.

title: gundam_gp-03_stamen
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam 0083]].

[b]RX-78GP-03S Dendrobium Stamen[/b]

The last of the machines produced under the Gundam Development Project, the Stamen [[mobile suit]] resembled the early [[Gundam GP-01 Zephyranthes]] but had a slightly asymmetrical head, thrusters and verniers all over its back and sub-arms stored inside the forearms for ease of use as its real purpose - acting as the core unit for the gigantic armament platform known as the [[dendrobium_schema|Dendrobium Orchis]].

title: nagasaki_anna

title: byalant
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]].

[b]RX-160 Byarlant[/b]

An aerospace combat [[mobile suit]] developed by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] for maximum agility and speed without any complex mechanisms or transformation gimmicks. It was piloted by [[Jerid Messa]]. 

Almost ten years after the Gryps Conflict and its first combat instance, a [[Byalant Custom|custom Byalant]] was seen in combat during the events of [[Gundam Unicorn]], piloted by a veteran ace of the Titans turned [[Earth Federation]] pilot. The rapid movement and exceptional offensive prowess of the unit led some fans to nickname it "Kobe Byarlant", [spoiler]and to some other fans theorize that it was [[Kou Uraki]] from [[Gundam 0083]][/spoiler].

title: robin_williams
body: Robin McLaurin Williams (July 21, 1951 ‚Äì August 11, 2014) was an American actor and comedian. Known for his improvisational skills and the wide variety of characters he created on the spur of the moment and portrayed on film, in dramas and comedies alike, Williams is regarded as one of the greatest comedians of all time.

title: stephen_hillenburg
body: [b]Stephen McDanell Hillenburg[/b] (August 21, 1961 - November 26, 2018) was an American marine biologist and animator. He is best known for being the creator of [[Spongebob Squarepants]].

title: doug_walker
body: Douglas Darien Walker (born November 17, 1981) is an Italian-born American comedian, film critic, actor and YouTuber. He is best known for creating and starring in the satirical film review web series [[Nostalgia Critic]], wherein the titular character reviews nostalgic media in an angry or profane manner.

title: carl_sagan
body: Carl Edward Sagan (/Ààse…™…°…ôn/; SAY-g…ôn; November 9, 1934 ‚Äì December 20, 1996) was an American astronomer, planetary scientist and [[science]] communicator. His best known scientific contribution is his research on the possibility of extraterrestrial life, including experimental demonstration of the production of amino acids from basic chemicals by exposure to light. He assembled the first physical messages sent into space, the Pioneer plaque and the Voyager Golden Record, which were universal messages that could potentially be understood by any extraterrestrial intelligence that might find them. He argued in favor of the hypothesis, which has since been accepted, that the high surface temperatures of Venus are the result of the greenhouse effect.

title: sebastian_pinera
body: Miguel Juan Sebasti√°n Pi√±era Echenique (1 December 1949 ‚Äì 6 February 2024) was a Chilean businessman and politician who served as President of [[Chile]] from 2010 to 2014 and again from 2018 to 2022.

title: augusto_jose_ramon_pinochet_ugarte
body: Augusto Jos√© Ram√≥n Pinochet Ugarte was a Chilean general, politician and dictator who ruled [[Chile]] from 1973 to 1990.

title: ivan_the_terrible
body: Ivan IV Vasilyevich (Russian: –ò–≤–∞–Ω IV –í–∞—Å–∏–ª—å–µ–≤–∏—á;1530 ‚Äì 1584), commonly known as Ivan the Terrible, was Grand Prince of [[Moscow]] and all [[Russia]] from 1533 to 1547, and the first Tsar and Grand Prince of all Russia from 1547 until his death in 1584. Ivan's reign was characterised by Russia's transformation from a medieval state to a fledgling empire, but at an immense cost to its people and long-term economy.

title: leon_trotsky
body: Lev Davidovich Bronstein (7 November [O.S. 26 October] 1879 ‚Äì 21 August 1940), better known as Leon Trotsky, was a [[russia|Russian]] revolutionary, Soviet politician, and political theorist. He was a central figure in the 1905 Revolution, October Revolution of 1917, Russian Civil War, and establishment of the Soviet Union, from which he was exiled in 1929 before his assassination in 1940. Trotsky and [[Vladimir Lenin]] were widely considered the two most prominent Soviet figures from 1917 until Lenin's death in 1924. Ideologically a Marxist and a Leninist, Trotsky's ideas inspired a school of Marxism known as Trotskyism.

title: claudia_sheinbaum
body: Claudia Sheinbaum Pardo (born 24 June 1962) is a Mexican politician, scientist, and academic who has served as the 66th president of [[Mexico]] since 2024, becoming the first woman to hold the office. She previously served as Head of Government of [[Mexico City]] from 2018 to 2023.

title: jurassic_park
body:
A 1993 science fiction-adventure film about a cloned [[dinosaur]] theme park, and the chaos that ensues, is based on Michael Crichton's 1990 novel of the same name.
The book was successful, as was Steven Spielberg's 1993 film adaptation. The film received a theatrical 3D re-release in 2013, and was selected in 2018 for preservation in the United States National Film Registry by the Library of Congress as being "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". Crichton's 1995 sequel novel, The Lost World, was followed by a 1997 film adaptation, also directed by Spielberg. Crichton did not write any further sequels in the series, although Spielberg would return as executive producer for each subsequent film, starting with Jurassic Park III (2001).
h4.Plot
Scientists funded by billionaire [[John Hammond]] have discovered how to bring extinct animals back to life via a complex cloning process. To make a profit off of this technology, Hammond and his company, InGen, decide to build a theme park featuring living [[dinosaur|dinosaurs]]. This in itself would not be such a bad idea ‚Äî except the organizers are rushing to get it open, have built it on a remote island, and have almost no security personnel, deciding instead to automate the whole thing with unreliable computers ‚Äî even refusing to tell the software designer what the system is for.

Naturally, everything that can go wrong does go wrong. And Hammond's invited guests to this soft opening ‚Äî paleontologist [[Alan Grant]], paleobotanist [[Ellie Sattler (Jurassic park)|]], chaotician [[Ian Malcolm]], lawyer Donald Gennaro and Hammond's own grandchildren Tim and Lex Murphy ‚Äî are caught in the middle of it all.

H4. See Also
* [[Jurassic World]]

title: danny_trejo
body:
Danny Trejo is an American actor. A native of Los Angeles, Trejo's film career began in 1985, when he landed a role in Runaway Train (1985). The first film in which he was given a proper credited role was as Art Sanella in Death Wish 4: The Crackdown (1987). He went on to star in a multitude of other films, many of which were small parts as inmates, gangsters, or other criminals, appearing in Desperado, Heat (both 1995), From Dusk till Dawn (1996), Con Air (1997), The Replacement Killers (1998), Reindeer Games (2000), and Once Upon a Time in Mexico (2003), among others.

From 2001 to 2003, Trejo appeared in the Robert Rodriguez-directed Spy Kids franchise as Isador "Machete" Cortez. Subsequently, in 2010, Trejo reprised his role as Machete in the spin-off exploitation action film Machete as the protagonist. With the success of Machete (2010), Trejo once again reprised his role in a direct sequel, Machete Kills (2013).

title: upturned_eyes
body:
When a character's eyes are pointed upwards relative to their face. This is often done to look cute, coy, childish, timid, submissive, or pleading.

This expression is sometimes accompanied by the [[head down|head tilted downward]], sometimes with face facing forward but [[looking up]], often occurs alongside [[raised eyebrows]]. It also occurs when a character is [[looking at viewer|looking at the viewer]], but is below their eye-level (such as often the case with [[fellatio]]).

This is different from [[rolling eyes]] or eyes rolled back in the head (as in [[ahegao]]) in that in this case something is actively being focused on and looked at. This is similar to [[sanpaku]] in that the white sclera of their eyes might be visible to three of four sides of their irises, but in this tag refers to a soft, gentle expression, whereas [[sanpaku]] refers to a shocked, angry, detatched, or unhinged expression.

h4. Examples

* !post #459094
* !post #1851379
* !post #2999790
* !post #3138080

h4. See also

* [[looking up]]
* [[downturned eyes]]
* [[sideways glance]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

title: koakuma
body:
A [[demon girl|female devil]]. Stage 4 midboss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] who lives in the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]], often seen in the [[Voile]] [[Library]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]], [[demon wings]] and [[bat wings|bat-like]] [[head wings]]. She has a [[demon tail]] and full [[demon wings]] on her back in some pictures.

It is generally assumed by the majority of fans that Koakuma is [[Patchouli Knowledge|Patchouli's]] summoned familiar and personal assistant, as she is rarely seen outside of the library unless accompanying the magician, and served as Patchouli's midboss in EoSD. She's also frequently depicted as a [[demon girl|succubus]] in fanworks, despite [[ZUN]] calling her more of an imp and her exact species being unknown.

Unused sprites in the EoSD game files include a possible "EX-Koakuma" with violet hair and a purple arcane aura, which might have been meant to appear alongside Patchouli during the Extra Stage midboss fight.

In [[Whispered Oracle of Hakurei Shrine]], her ability has been revealed as "capable of finding target book in an instant", which can be interpreted as she listens to the books' "whispers/sounds" and triangulates their location like some kind of bat sonar. In the same work, It is also states that she is like a magical creature similar to [[Patchouli Knowledge|Patchouli]] and the various fairies, which is in line with [[ZUN]]'s definition of "Devil":[https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Devil], where he describes them as 'large species that can include vampires and magicians among other similar things'.
h4. Example

* !post #6561651: Usual Appearance

h4. External links

title: yugiri_tsuzuri
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 102nd graduating class. 

She is often absent-minded, and has a peculiar way of speaking. But on stage, she is an excellent performer.

She has [[red eyes|red]]/[[pink eyes]] and [[short hair]] which is predominantly [[white hair|white]]-to-[[grey hair|grey]] with [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] and [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]. Her hair is typically styled in an [[inverted bob]] with [[diagonal bangs]] and [[star hair ornament]]s. In her first year at Hasu no Sora, she used to wear a black [[hairclip]].

She often wears [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[black choker|black]] [[o-ring choker]], [[black pantyhose|black]] [[pantyhose]], and [[black shoes]] with her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|uniform]]. She also wears the choker with her [[summer uniform]]. 

She has graduated from Hasu no Sora along with fellow 102nd year members [[Otomune Kozue]] and [[Fujishima Megumi]] in March 2025, thus ending her school idol activities at Hasu no Sora. 
Her next goal after graduation is to be a [[teacher]].

Voiced by [[Sasaki Kotoko]].

title: baseball_cap
body:
A type of soft cap with a long, stiff bill that may either be curved or flat. The back of the cap may have an adjuster.

Traditionally, the bill is worn forward, shielding the eyes from the sun, but it is also often worn backwards or at other angles. Use [[backwards hat]] as well in that case.

Whether or not the wearer is actually doing something related to baseball is irrelevant when using this tag.

h4. See Also

* [[baseball uniform]]
* [[visor cap]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

body: [b]Chi: Chiky≈´ no Und≈ç ni Tsuite[/b] (English: Orb: On the Movements of the Earth) is an 8 volume historical drama manga series written and illustrated by Uoto. An anime adaptation aired during the 2024 fall season.

title: kirby_air_ride
body:
A multiplayer [[Kirby_(series)|]] racing game released for the [[Nintendo]] [[Gamecube]] in 2003. It sets itself apart from other racing games in that your "kart" ("[[warp star|Star]]" in this game) is controlled with only the Control Stick and the A button.

This game's sequel, [[Kirby Air Riders]], is set to release for the [[Nintendo Switch 2]] in 2025, over two decades later.

h4. External links

* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Kirby_Air_Ride

body:

Receiving a new look, she wears a [[brown jacket]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[shirt]] with [[clothes writing|the words]] "I am Puppy" written on it and a [[blue collar|blue]] [[dog collar|animal collar]].

In contrast to her original appearance, her hair is now [[brown hair|brown]], and is decorated with multiple [[hair ornament|]]s. She has [[heterochromia]], with one [[brown eyes|brown eye]] and one [[blue eyes|blue eye]].

She wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[pink jacket]] with a [[white shirt]] underneath it and [[pink shorts|pink]] [[short shorts]]. Her [[asymmetrical legwear|legwear is asymmetrical]], one one leg she wears a [[black thighhighs|black thighigh]] and the other a [[black socks|black sock]] She also has a red [[thigh strap]] and wears [[brown slippers|brown]] [[animal slippers|dog slippers]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] and [[white hair]] worn in [[twin braids]].

It has 2 different styles, one being a [[white leotard]] and the other being a [[white tube top]] with a [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt]], it comes with a [[pink jacket]], [[white gloves|white]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]].

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]] in this outfit, she has either [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair]] tied into [[twintails]] done or she wears her hair in a [[two side up]]-fashion.

title: thistle_(dungeon_meshi)
body: AKA "the mad sorcerer" or "the lunatic magician", Thistle is the "master" of the dungeon in which most of [[Dungeon Meshi]] takes place. He's an [[androgynous]] [[dark skin]]ned [[dark elf|elf]] in the appearance of a [[long hair]]ed [[otoko no ko|boy]] who [spoilers]has been keeping himself and his entire kingdom alive in a sort of suspended animation underground by way of a [[winged lion (dungeon meshi)|demon]]'s magic for over 1000 years.[/spoilers]

Dressing up for her birthday, she now wears a [[short sleeves|short]] [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[white sleeves|white sleeved]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[frilled dress]], with a [[pink bow]] that has a [[Bubi (ironmouse)|]] pin on it, [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[white thighhighs]], [[white garter straps]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]] in this outfit, she has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair|pink]]/[[purple hair|purple]] [[streaked hair]] that are worn in [[twin braids]] and are linked together.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25407210: Profile

title: mithrun
body:
One of the "Canaries" in [[Dungeon Meshi]], a squad of [[elf|elven]] criminals and nobles sent to dungeons to evaluate the danger they pose to the world. He's easily recognized by his [[lazy_eye|false eye]] (sometimes covered by his messy [[silver_hair|silver]] bangs), [[notched_ear|cut-off eartips]], and [[expressionless]] face.

Mithrun was at one point the "master" of a dungeon, and as such has unique insight into how they work. [spoilers]His tenure came to an end when [[goat (dungeon meshi)|the demon controlling the dungeon]] ate all of his desires except for his newfound desire to kill demons. As such, the rest of the squad has to remind him to do things like eat, drink, and sleep, because he has no desire to do them on his own.[/spoilers] He is an expert teleporter, who can even attack by teleporting his opponents inside of brick walls, although this ability is hindered somewhat by his lack of depth perception and directional awareness.

His squadmates include:
* [[Cithis]] (his "babysitter")
* [[Pattadol]]
* [[Fleki]]
* [[Otta (dungeon meshi)|]]
* [[Lycion]]

h4. External links
* "Adventurer's Bible entry":[https://mangadex.org/chapter/6665b0ad-97e2-4f88-8249-0148a4c6e123]

This model also has a [[tan]] mode, which changes her [[pink hair|default hair]] to [[black hair|black]] with [[streaked hair|pink streaks]] and her [[purple eyes]] to [[red eyes|red]]. title: dokibird_(vtuber)_(bounty_hunter)
body:
The current default costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[Dokibird (vtuber)|]], designed by [[Kamameshi Gougoumaru]], replacing her [[Dokibird (VTuber) (retro doki)|old default]] from June 2024 on. Bears a striking resemblance to her [[Selen Tatsuki|other persona]] and was created by the same artist, right down to having the iconic long-neck toggle.

In this costume, she wears a [[black jacket]] worn over a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[yellow neckerchief]], [[white pants]], [[black gloves]] and [[black boots|black]] [[cowboy boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, has cut her [[long hair]] [[short hair|short]] and is now [[spiked hair|spiky]] and has a [[x hair ornament]].

title: amane_kanata_(another_world)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Amane Kanata]], it was debuted during her 3rd anniversary 3D live concert [i]"Another World"[/i] and has a [[fallen angel]] theme.

It consists of a [[black collar|black]] [[animal collar]], an  [[o-ring top|o-ring]] [[chest harness|chest]] [[o-ring harness|harness]] a [[black bra|black]] [[lace-trimmed bra|lace-trimmed]] [[strapless bra]], multiple [[arm strap|arm]] and [[wrist straps]] on her right arm and [[bandaged arm|bandages]] on her left arm, [[black gloves]], a large [[black belt]] with a large [[blue rose]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt]] with a [[gold trim]]med [[black skirt|black]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]]-length layers, and a layered [[overskirt]] with a [[see-through skirt|see-through]] layer and a [[torn skirt|torn]] blue layer, a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[blue thighhighs|blue thighhigh]] on her right leg an a [[heart o-ring|heart]] [[o-ring thigh strap]] and an [[ankle garter]]/[[anklet]] on her left leg, and [[black shoes|black]] [[pumps]].

Fitting with the fallen angel theme her halo is now [[blue halo|dark blue]], her [[colored inner hair]] is a darker shade of [[blue hair|blue]] and has a dark [[purple hair|purple]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], her [[streaked hair|hair streaks]] are also purple now too and her wings are now darker with the [[gradient wings|gradient]] going from [[grey wings|grey]] to [[blue wings|dark blue]] and she has an [[multiple wings|additional]] pair of [[black wings]] pointing down.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair]] done in a [[half updo]] with [[double bun]]s.

h4. Appearance

title: zako_(phrase)
body:
[i]Zaa~ko[/i] is a phrase which originates from [[Yuzu-Soft]]'s game [[Tenshi Souzou Re-boot!]]. One of the main heroines, [[Tanikaze Amane]] teases her brother, a former demon lord who lost his power, by calling him a zako. It can be translated as a "small fry" or "prey", something really small and weak, like level 1 monsters. "Loser" is a close English equivalent.

title: fourth_wall
body:
The imaginary "wall" that separates a piece of fiction from the real-life audience.

This tag is used when that wall is "broken" by the characters involved indicating they realize that they are set in fiction, usually by addressing the audience or interacting with elements of the medium, such as grabbing a speech bubble, seeing the content of speech or thought bubbles, and similar actions.

[[Deadpool]] in particular is known for his constant breaking of the fourth wall.

The pixiv tag is "„É°„ÇøÁô∫Ë®Ä (meta quote).":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag_full&word=%E3%83%A1%E3%82%BF%E7%99%BA%E8%A8%80 However, "[[meta]]" tag on danbooru has a bit different meaning.

h4. See also

* [[against fourth wall]]
* [[through medium]]
** [[through screen]]
** [[through painting]]
** [[through page]]

title: sam_&_max
body: Sam and Max is an American franchise created by Steve Purcell. It originally began as a comic book series in 1987 before the franchise gained fame when it was turned into a point and click adventure game, Sam & Max Hit the Road, by Lucas Arts in 1993 on PC. It was later turned into an animated series, The Adventures of Sam & Max: Freelance Police, which aired for one season from 1997 to 1998. Sam and Max return in video game format in 2006 as a series of adventure games by Telltale Games.

title: uss_intrepid_(cv-11)
body:
A member of the [i]Essex[/i]-class [[aircraft carrier]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1943, it earned eight battle stars for combat service in the Pacific Theater of [[World War II]] and the [[Vietnam War]], and was a recovery vessel for several space missions. [i]Intrepid[/i] was decommissioned for the last time in 1974, and is currently a museum ship in [[New York City]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises such as [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. Depictions

title: uss_iowa_(bb-61)
body:
The lead and namesake ship of the [i]Iowa[/i]-class [[battleship]]s of the [[United States Navy]]. First commissioned in 1943, it earned eleven battle stars from combat service in both the Pacific and Atlantic Theaters of [[World War II]] as well as the [[Korean War]], and was decommissioned for the last time in 1990. It is currently a museum ship at the Port of [[Los Angeles]].

This tag is for depictions of the ship itself, as well as personifications of the ship outside of established franchises such as [[Kantai Collection]].

h4. Depictions

title: donkey_kong_(series)
body:
The [i]Donkey Kong[/i] series is a franchise of games created by [[Nintendo]] centering around the titular character, [[Donkey Kong]]. It's first title was responsible for the birth of Nintendo's two most iconic characters, Donkey Kong and [[Mario]], which in turn lead to the creation of the highly successful [i][[Mario (series)|Mario series]][/i]. 

The plot usually revolves around Donkey Kong and his friends, collectively known as the "Kong Family", and their adventures, usually centered in the location of Donkey Kong Island.

While the early arcade titles have Donkey Kong in a non-playable and mostly antagonistic role, since Donkey Kong Country he has also become the starring protagonist in many titles since.

title: los_angeles
body:
Los Angeles (often appreviated "LA") is a major city located in Southern [[California]], [[United States]]. It is the largest city in California and the second-largest city in the United States by population, after [[New York City]]. It is also large geographically: the greater Los Angeles area encompasses a vast metropolitan patchwork that stretches across approximately 503 square miles (1,302 square kilometers), including a number of outlying communities and suburbs. Los Angeles' Spanish translation, "The Angels", gives the city both its main nickname ("The City of Angels") as well as the name of one of its two Major League [[Baseball]] teams. 

Los Angeles is renowned for its entertainment industry, particularly Hollywood, which is the center of the American film and television industry. Many major film studios, production companies, and entertainment-related businesses are based in Los Angeles. The city is also known for its thriving music scene, hosting numerous concerts, festivals, and a variety of cultural events.

Los Angeles is also famous for its iconic landmarks, including the [[Hollywood Sign]], the Walk of Fame, Griffith Observatory, Santa Monica Pier, Universal Studios Hollywood, Getty Center, and many others. 

h4. Locations

title: volkswagen_beetle
body:
The [b]Volkswagen Beetle[/b], officially the "Volkswagen Type 1", is a two-door, four passenger, rear-engine economy [[car]] manufactured and marketed by German automaker [[Volkswagen]] (VW) from 1938 until 2003.

Originated from an initiative of [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] to produce the "people's car", the Beetle is the longest-running and most-manufactured [[car]] of a single platform ever made. Because of its very cheap price and reliability It was the best selling civilian four wheeled motor vehicle during the [[Cold War]].

h4. See also

* [[Herbie (character)]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

title: new_york_city
body:
The largest city of the [[New York State|state of New York]]. It is also the largest city in the [[United States]] and a major commercial and cultural center. 

Founded by the Dutch as New Amsterdam, it was renamed by the English in honor of the Duke of York. Originally consisting only of Manhattan Island, it was rechartered in 1898 to include the five present-day boroughs of Manhattan, the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens, and Staten Island. It is the main site of the [[9/11]] terrorist attack.

New York is the central location for many of [[Marvel]]'s comic series and superheroes, being home to Avengers Tower in the [[Avengers (series)|]] comics and the Baxter Building; the [[fantastic four|Fantastic Four's]] headquarters, as well as being the home city and main setting for [[Spider-Man]] and [[Daredevil]]'s stories.

h4. Locations

title: quebec
body:
Use for posts referencing Quebec, such as the Quebecois Flag, Quebecois Sports teams such as the Montreal Canadiens, and/or depicting [[real world location]]s or culture such as food. 

Qu√©bec is a province of [[Canada]]. It is Canada's largest province by area, bordering Ontario in the west, Newfoundland and Labrador to the northeast, and New Brunswick to the southeast, and has coastal borders with Nunavut. 

The official language of the province is French. Quebec French (also known as Qu√©b√©cois) is the predominant variety, having some differences (primarily in pronunciations and vocabulary) when compared to European French. 

The province was settled by Paleo-Indians during the Last Glacial Maximum and was first explored by Europeans under Jacques Cartier in 1534, who would claim it for the Kingdom of France. France would continue to hold on to the colony until 1763, when ownership of the colony was transferred to the United Kingdom after the French and Indian War (AKA the Seven Years' War). It would later join the Dominion of Canada in 1867. In 1960, the Quiet Revolution would achieve major reforms throughout the province.

The capital of Qu√©bec is Qu√©bec City (French: Ville de Qu√©bec) and the largest cities are [[Montreal|Montr√©al]], Gatineau, Trois-Rivi√®res, and Sherbrooke. 

Qu√©bec is the birthplace of [[poutine]] and is known for helping to popularize the sport of [[ice hockey]].

h4. See also

* [[Quebecois flag|Qu√©b√©cois flag]]
* [[Louisiana]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Quebec":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quebec]

[[Italy|Italian]] automobile manufacturer known for high-performance [[motor vehicle]]s. Almost all of their [[sports car]]s are powered by 12-cylinder engines, as is often tradition for high-end Italian automakers.

They also have a lesser known division producing agricultural [[tractor]]s, which are the company's original main line of products.

Lamborghini's main rivals include [[Ferrari]] and [[Porsche]].

title: daiyousei
body:
Daiyousei's name is fangiven, meaning literally "great fairy." [[Touhou]] midboss of [[Cirno]]'s stage in [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]]. 

Thought to be friends with her, portrayed as more mature and coolheaded than other fairies. In Oriental Sacred Place, she was portrayed as incredibly shy, hiding from anyone that wasn't Cirno. The Fandom might draw her with larger breasts than any other fairy, thanks to her fan name.

She has [[green hair]] in a [[high side ponytail]] tied with a [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[hair bow]] and her eyes are usually either [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[green eyes|green]]. She wears a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[yellow ascot]], and either a [[skirt set|paired]] [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt]] or a [[blue dress|blue]] [[pinafore dress]]. Out of all the Touhou fairies, she is most frequently depicted with [[white wings|white]] [[fairy wings]]. 

In [[Whispered Oracle of Hakurei Shrine]], her ability has been revealed as "to swim through mist". Whether this means she can move through the mist with incredible ease, as if she's teleporting through them, or her "swim through mist" is more akin to "thrive in the mist" and become stronger in the mist is up to interpretation.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24773281

h4. See also

* [[Daiyousei mob (Touhou)]], two other fairies with the same wing type

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Daiyousei":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Daiyousei

title: animation_meme
body:
A short [[animated]] [[video]] typically set to [[audible music]]. These videos are then recreated by other animators with their own characters or characters from media franchises. These videos tend to be simple and repetitive, often focusing on dancing.

The format evolved on YouTube in the late 2000s when Japanese MAD trends such as [[Caramelldansen]] and [[Caipirinha (meme)|]] were imported to the site from NicoNico, with the first true animation meme being the Nya Nya Dance, posted by webkinzlid in 2009.

This tag should only be used on posts that explicitly call themselves such or are based on videos that were designed to be replicated, not [[parody|parodies]] in general.

h4. See also

* [[derivative work]]
* [[meme]]
* [[parody]]

h4. External links

* "Fanlore: Animation Meme":https://fanlore.org/wiki/Animation_Meme
* "Know Your Meme: Animation Memes":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/animation-memes

title: arthur_leywin
body:
[b]Arthur Leywin[/b] is the main protagonist of [[The Beginning After The End]]. In his previous life, he was a king named Grey before he was reincarnated into a new world, on the continent of Dicathen.

In his former world, he lived as a king who stood on the top of his country in terms of combat, until he was presumably assassinated through poison one day. However, after living four years as Arthur Leywin, he reawoke as King Grey, as if he wasn't poisoned.

After being reincarnated into the Leywin Family, Grey decided that, unlike his previous life, he would live his life to the fullest. To be loved, and surrounded by the friends and family he was void of in his past life.

h1.External Links
"TBATE wiki: Arthur Leywin":[https://tbate.fandom.com/wiki/Arthur_Leywin]

title: coin_sword
body:
A coin sword (alternatively spelt as coin-sword), or cash-sword, are a type of Chinese numismatic charm that is a form of feng shui talisman primarily used in southern China to ward off evil spirits and malicious influences, especially those inducing fever. Coin-swords are also often used in Taoist rituals. Coin-swords are considered an "evil-warding sword" in China.

title: nrvnqsr_chaos
body:
[tn][i]Pronounced "Nero" chaos[/i][/tn]

A character in [[Tsukihime]] and [[Melty Blood]]. One of the oldest of the 27 Dead Apostles Ancestors and one of the most exceptional. 

He is an accumulated chaotic mass of 666 beasts that swirl within him, and he unleashes these beasts to devour his victims blood, meat and bones whole. He plans to swallow [[Arcueid Brunestud]] in order to claim unrivaled power among the highest rank of vampires and is an old friend of [[Michael Roa Valdamjong]]. In the Melty Blood series he is a reoccurring manifestation of [[wallachia|TATARI]].

He has [[grey hair]], [[grey eyes]] and his face has [[pale skin]]. He wears a [[blue_coat|blue]]/[[black_coat|black]] [[trench coat]] and most of his body below his neck is the total [[black_skin|blackness]] of chaos. 

Before becoming a vampire his human name was [b]Fabro Rowan[/b], who appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. In the [[Tsukihime (remake)|Tsukihime Remake]] his role in the story was replaced by [[Vlov Arkhangel]].

title: saitou_shimaru
body:
3rd unit captain of the [[shinsengumi (gintama)|Shinsengumi]]. Based off of [[Saitou Hajime]].

A powerful combatant with a large [[orange hair|orange]] afro, leading him to be nicked "Wolfro". Doesn't say much, but is in reality incredibly shy and uses his face mask as an excuse to not say anything. Sleeps often.

title: kaela_kovalskia_(4th_costume)
body:
The current default of [[hololive indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Kaela Kovalskia]], revealed in March 2025, specifically her redebut, replacing her [[kaela kovalskia (1st costume)|original default costume]].

In this costume, she wears a [[black coat]] with a [[black scarf]] worn over a [[red sweater|red]] [[cropped sweater|cropped]] [[ribbed sweater]], a [[single glove|single]] [[red gloves|red glove]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], a red [[o-ring thigh strap]] and [[black boots]].

For her default hairstyle, she has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[red hairband]], a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]] and [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] [[sunglasses]] styled after welding [[goggles on head|goggles on her head]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9054017: Profile

body:
Use this tag when a character has a [[rabbit]]-like [[tail]].

If the tail is real, add [[rabbit girl]] or [[rabbit boy]] accordingly. If the tail is fake, like the kind worn by [[Playboy bunny|Playboy bunnies]], add [[fake tail]].

h4. See also

* [[rabbit ears]]

title: illuminati_office_lady_(april_fools_day)
body:
She is an [[april fools|April Fools' Day]] character that surged in popularity on April 1st, 2025.

She has [[white hair]] [[two-tone hair|with]] a [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|underdye]]. Her eyes are portrayed as either light [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[grey eyes|grey]].

She is typically wearing a [[white shirt]] with a [[necktie]] that matches her [[blue skirt|blue]] or [[black skirt]]. Her accessories include yellow [[triangle earrings]], blue [[fake animal ears]], an [[id card]] with a yellow triangle on it, and a [[toeless legwear|toeless]] [[single sock|sock]] on her left leg. 

Many drawings of her include [[Illuminati]] imagery, such as a [[third eye]] on her forehead.

title: don't_care_didn't_ask_(meme)
body:
Series of reaction images that indicate the poster's lack of desire to consider one's opinion, often citing racial or another kind of prejudice. Originated from an image of 50 cent showing two middle fingers captioned "Don't care didn't ask plus you're white".

A variant of the meme is "Do care, did ask".

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Don't Care, Didn't Ask / 50 Cent Middle Finger":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/dont-care-didnt-ask-50-cent-middle-finger

title: invincible_(series)
body:
Superhero comic series by Robert Kirkman and published by Image comics. An animated adaptation of the series premiered on Amazon Prime in 2021 to high praise, being renewed for two more seasons only a month after debut. The second season aired in two parts, the first part from November 3, 2023 to November 24, 2023 and the second part from March 14, 2024 to April 4, 2024. The third season aired in 2025 with a fourth season being scheduled to air in 2026.

h4. See also
* [[Think Mark Think! (meme)]]

title: white_haired_girl_(chainsaw_man)
body:
A placeholder name for a [i][[Chainsaw Man]][/i] character introduced as the end of chapter 195.

While initially implied to be the [spoilers]Death Devil, in chapter 198, she is revealed to be the Famine Devil. [[Fami (Chainsaw Man)|"Fami"]] turns out to be the actual Death Devil, who is using her identity as an alias.[/spoilers]

title: thigh_sex
body:
A [[tag group:sex acts|sex act]] in which a person rubs their [[penis]] in between their partner's closed [[thighs]]. Also known as intercrural or interfemoral sex, or sometimes by the Japanese term 'sumata' („Åô„Åæ„Åü).

Not to be confused with [[kneepit sex]] or [[thigh straddling]]. Use [[grinding]] instead when the [[penis]] is rubbed directly on the [[pussy]] instead of between the [[thighs]].

This tag is somewhat of a misnomer because while the word [[sex]] is used, it shouldn't be tagged as such as well. Sex is only when the penis is inserted into the vaginal or anal cavities.

h4. See also

* [[frottage]]
* [[grinding]]
* [[kneepit sex]]
* [[Tag Group:Sex Acts]]

title: arsenal_bird
body: A boss from [[ace_combat_7|Ace Combat 7]]. The Arsenal Birds were automated airborne fortresses developed by Osea to assist in the defense of the International Space Elevator. After the outbreak of the Lighthouse War, both were hijacked by Erusea. The Arsenal Bird's armaments and defenses include missiles, lasers, and an energy shield, but the bulk of their offensive power is centered on the large numbers of drone fighters they carry, and can rapidly deploy into battle.

title: alicorn_(ace_combat)
body: A super-submarine that appears in [[ace_combat_7|Ace Combat 7's]] DLC missions. Intended as a successor to the [i]Scinfaxi[/i]-class submarines, [i]Alicorn[/i] is larger and more heavily-armed, carrying two short-range railguns, a longer-range one capable of firing nuclear shells, a large air wing, and VLS tubes. Bizarrely for a submarine, she does not carry torpedoes. Her captain was Matias Torres, who went insane and believed that the only way to stop the Lighthouse War was to use his ship's nuclear capabilities to kill one million people to save ten million more.

title: final_destination_(film)
body:
[b]Final Destination[/b] is a Horror film series created by Jeffrey Reddick and developed by New Line Cinema. Each films follow a group of survivors who survive a horrific accident after one of them received a vision that shows their deaths of the incident and warn the others. Despite escaping their untimely demise, the survivors anger [[Death (entity)|]], which is portrayed as an unseen force, who despise those who cheat Death as it goes against the natural order and kills the survivors that were supposed to die horrifically. As they get killed one by one, the Survivors try to find a way to save themselves from Death's wrath.

As of 2025, there are currently six Final Destination movies including several novels and comics. Apart from "Death", the only other recurring character in the series is William Bludworth, a Funeral director who mysteriously knows, how and why Death is after the survivors while giving them advice on how to save their lives, who is played by the late Tony Todd.

title: death
body:
Refers to the cessation of a living organism's vital function. Use this tag that features dead or dying people, creatures, or animals, or that implies a death has taken place.

If the corpse or cause of death isn't explicitly shown but you can infer a death has taken place, use [[implied death]].

For the Grim Reaper or other personifications of death, see [[Death (entity)]]. For the tarot card "Death", see [[Death (tarot)]].

h4. See also

title: pekomama
body:
[[Usada Pekora]]'s [[real life insert|real]] mother. After surpassing a million subscribers, Pekora fulfilled a promise she'd made a while before and revealed to her mother, live and on stream, her occupation as a [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. She is usually depicted as an older, motherly Pekora. However, she does not hesitate to embarrass Pekora whenever possible.

On April 1st 2024, she got her own "official" 2D model designed by [[hikosan]] and had her first solo stream on Pekora's channel. That said livestream later became viral, and spawned numerous NSFW art of her in the process.

Like her daughter, she is a [[rabbit girl]] with [[rabbit ears]] and [[rabbit tail|tail]]. She has [[red eyes]] with [[rabbit-shaped pupils]] and [[short eyebrows|short]] [[thick eyebrows]] . For her outfit, she wears a [[white dress]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]] worn over a [[black bodysuit]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white slippers|white]] [[bunny slippers]].

For her default hairstyle, she has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair|blue]] and [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair]] tied into a [[braided ponytail]] [[hair over shoulder|that goes over her shoulder]] held with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7403198: Reference sheet

h4. See Also

* [[Ma Matsuri]]
* [[Mamarissa]]

h4. External links

* "Anime News Network: hololive's Usada Pekora Comes Out as a Virtual YouTuber to Her Mother":[https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2020-12-15/hololive-usada-pekora-comes-out-as-a-virtual-youtuber-to-her-mother/.167420]

title: hatsune_miku
body:
Hatsune Miku is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, originally released for the VOCALOID2 engine on August 31, 2007. She was the first of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is recognizable by her [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]] and [[aqua eyes]], although she is commonly depicted with [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] or [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie]], has [[long sleeves|long]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has a [[number tattoo]] [[shoulder tattoo|on her shoulder]].

She is voiced by [[Fujita Saki]], and her first appearance was illustrated by [[KEI (Keigarou)|]].

title: fukuzawa_ayu_(redfalcon23)
body: Original character created by artist RedFalcon23, Ayu is a young girl in junior high who has been blind since birth but also harbors superhuman strength. She is a polite, curious girl who loves going on adventures. Her pet rabbit [[Chimu_(RedFalcon23)]] serves as her guide animal when there are no other humans around.

title: jiru-kun_(usada_pekora)
body:
[[Usada Pekora]]'s real life pet "Senegal Bushbaby":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Senegal_bushbaby], it's name is often romanized as Jill-kun.

Raised to memetic status after Pekora herself noted all the comments from overseas fans in disbelief that she bought A FUCKING MONKEY.

On April 1st 2025, it got its own "official" 2D model designed by [[hikosan]] and had its first stream on Pekora's channel. Voiced by one of Pekora's kouhai [[hololive]] [[hololive_dev_is|DEV IS]] [[Kikirara Vivi]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #9084137: Reference Sheet

h4. External links
* "The monkey in question":[https://twitter.com/uraakapeko/status/1591095472516919296]

body: Song by [[iyowa_(igusuri_please)|]] featuring [[Hatsune Miku]].

title: mazda_montgomery_(dlshowtime)
body: Original character belonging to artist DLShowtime. She is the daughter of his character Alexus Montgomery and inherited her mother's blue eyes, dog tags, large bust, and inhuman strength. She is adventurous, charismatic, and kindhearted. [[Sephira_Summers_(Parasyte123)]] is her half-sister as they share the same father.

title: chimu_(redfalcon23)
body: Chimu is a rabbit belonging to [[Fukuzawa_Ayu_(RedFalcon23)]] who doubles as her guide animal due to her blindness. He's been a part of her life for as long as she can remember and fancies himself a bit of a ladies man since so many girls are drawn to his cuteness. He and Ayu are also able to understand each other quite well and he's always watching over her like a guardian.

title: kasane_neko_(haru57928031)
body:
Unofficial cat girl design for [[Kasane Teto]] popularized by [[haru57928031]]. A redesign of her original [[UTAU]] outfit featuring a black hooded jacket, a backpack with a black cat sitting inside, sneakers, small detached wings, and a cat eared megaphone. She also has the [[hair bow]] of her [[Kasane Teto (SV)|SV]] design. Sometimes accompanied by a twin drill cat baguette. 

* !post #7807002: Character Sheet

h4. See also

* [[List of vocal synth derivatives]]

title: jefuty_(bakery_girl)
body:
Main protagonist of [[Codename: Bakery Girl]] and its remake [[reverse collapse (series)|Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] alongside a pair of [[blue eyes]]. Clothing-wise, she commonly either wears a [[damaged|ragged]] [[brown coat]] with her left leg [[bandaged leg|bandaged]] while wielding a [[Mosin-Nagant]] or a [[white coat|white]] [[winter coat]] with [[black fur| black]] [[fur trim]]s while holding an [[anti-materiel rifle]] with a [[snow camouflage|snow/winter]] [[camouflage|camo]] pattern.

At the end of Chapter 1, it is revealed that Jefuty [spoilers]has the ability to transfer her memories towards other Jefutys upon death to aid them in their goal of escaping the URNC with her sister [[Lige (bakery girl)|]] towards the AU.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7435372

title: rig_shokew
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]].

[b]ZM-S22S Rig Shokew[/b]

A mass-production version of the prototype ZMT-S12G [[Shokew]] [[Zanscare]] [[mobile suit]] with several improvements. The Rig Shokew has increased generator output, a new backpack, additional verniers for greater maneuverability, and a greater amount of more powerful thrusters for better speed and acceleration. 

A higher amount of titanium was incorporated in the alloy of its armor, giving it better durability. The Rig Shokew stands a meter taller, and the added size adds a bit to the empty weight, yet when fully-loaded it is lighter than the original Shokew.

title: silver_(pokemon)
body:
A recurring character in the [[Pokemon]] series.

While he generally retains the same appearance and role (a boy with [[red eyes]] and [[red hair]] who often wears a [[black shirt]], and being the son of the notorious [[Giovanni (pokemon)|]]), he has several incarnations with different backstory.

In [[Pokemon GSC]] and [[Pokemon HGSS|HGSS]], he is a rival of the player character. In [[Pokemon Adventures]], he is an anti-hero protagonist in the [i]GSC chapter[/i] and the [i]HGSS chapter[/i]. Initially, he is a mysterious thief.

No definitive name is given for him in the core series. His default name is [b]Silver[/b] in [i]Pok√©mon Gold[/i] and [i]Pok√©mon Crystal[/i], [b]Gold[/b] in [i]Pok√©mon Silver[/i], [b]Soul[/b] in [i]Pok√©mon HeartGold[/i], and [b]Heart[/b] in [i]Pok√©mon SoulSilver[/i]. He is sometimes called [b]Kamon[/b] by fans.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #22573514: [[Pokemon HGSS]]

title: pencil_mustache

title: black_frieza
body: First appearing in the manga version of [[Dragon Ball Super]], it is a black, silver, and purple-colored power-up form achieved by [[Frieza]] after he [spoilers]trained for 10 years inside a Room of Spirit and Time on a planet he conquered[/spoilers]. Not only is this form very much superior to his [[Golden Frieza]] form, it is also powerful enough for Frieza to [spoilers]easily defeat both [[Ultra Instinct]] [[Son Goku]] and [[Ultra Ego (dragon ball)|]] [[Vegeta]] in a single blow[/spoilers].

title: sunday_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable [[Honkai: Star Rail]] character, and [[brother and sister|brother]] to [[Robin (Honkai: Star Rail)|]]. Voiced by [[Ootsuka Takeo]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair|grey]]/light [[blue hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[head wings]], and a [[halo]]. His default outfit consists of a [[grey shirt]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket]], [[white gloves]], [[earrings]], [[white pants]] with a single [[white belt|white]] [[thigh belt]] on his left leg, and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

His playable version replaces his white pants with [[black pants|black]] ones, while his gloves also turn [[black gloves|black]]. His thigh belt is now colored [[blue belt|blue]] and is moved to his right leg. 

[spoilers]As of Patch 2.7 after becoming a playable character, he is currently residing in the [[Astral Express (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] as a passenger.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #8651686: Splash art (playable)
* !post #8768138: Original outfit (from "After the Charmony Fall" Light Cone)
* !post #8534587: [[Sunday (Brilliant Youth) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Brilliant Youth]]
* !post #9062711: [[Sunday (Star Rail Live 2025) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Star Rail Live 2025]]

h4. See also 
* [[Septimus (honkai: star rail)|]] [b](Spoiler alert)[/b]

Pokemon Breeders from [[pokemon sm|Sun & Moon]] are almost identical in design to the [[Rancher (pokemon)|]] and [[Cowgirl (pokemon)|]] trainers from [[pokemon dppt|Diamond & Pearl]].

h4. External links 

* "'Bulbapedia: Pok√©mon Breeder (Trainer class)":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Breeder_%28Trainer_class%29

title: iris_(pokemon)
body:
A [[Pokemon]] character.

In the games, Iris is a young, nature-loving girl and Unova's eighth Gym Leader in [[Pokemon BW|Pok√©mon White]]. Her specialty is Dragon-types, and she is [[Drayden (pokemon)|]]'s apprentice. Her main Pok√©mon is [[Haxorus]]. She returns in [[pokemon bw2|Pok√©mon Black and White 2]] as the new Champion of the Unova region.

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], she is also one of [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]]'s former companions. She has a [[Axew]] that lives in her hair. Like [[Misty (pokemon)|]], Iris is frequently critical of Ash's actions as a trainer, calling him childish. She aims to be a master of Dragon-type Pok√©mon, and must evolve her [[Axew]] into it's final stage, [[Haxorus]] to be considered one. She is also known for being the first naturally dark-skinned main character in the Pok√©mon series. She returns in [[pokemon journeys|Pok√©mon Journeys]] in her capacity as Champion of Unova, and battles Ash as he climbs the ranks of the World Coronation Series. [spoiler]Eventually, she joins Ash in the Masters Eight.[/spoilers]

h4. Official Art
* !post #5549883: [[pokemon bw|BW]]
* !post #5549892: [[pokemon bw2|BW2]]

title: shiny_pokemon
body:
A [[pokemon|Pok√©mon]] whose colors are from the [[alternate color|"shiny" palette]] of the games, that are different from their usual colors. Known for being incredibly rare. See also [[shiny and normal]].

For example, [[Gyarados]] are blue, but [i]shiny[/i] Gyarados are red.

h5. Notes

* Not to be confused with [[shiny]] (or [[shiny skin]], or [[shiny clothes]]), as in something that shines, as if they were wet or oiled.
* See also [[alternate shiny pokemon]] for Pok√©mon with a color palette that isn't shiny or normal.

h4. Notable searches

h5. Pok√©mon species

title: ace_trainer_(pokemon)
body:
A trainer class archetype in the [[pokemon|Pok√©mon]] games. They are depicted as teens or young adults, and can be male or female. Previously known as [b]Cooltrainers[/b]. They generally use strong and evolved Pok√©mon, have a diversified and balanced party, and their artificial intelligence is generally very good compared to other Trainer types in their games.

h4. See also

* [[List of Pokemon characters]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Ace Trainer (Trainer class)":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Ace_Trainer_%28Trainer_class%29

title: pokemon_platinum
body:
The game [i]Pok√©mon Platinum[/i]. This is a subset of [[pokemon dppt]] (Pok√©mon Diamond, Pearl and Platinum).

Use this tag only for things that appear in [i]Platinum[/i] but don't appear in [i]Diamond and Pearl[/i]. This includes some [i]Platinum[/i]-exclusive characters and designs.

This tag is similar to [[pokemon emerald|Pok√©mon Emerald]].

h4. Outfits

* {{dawn_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Dawn wearing her [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{lucas_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Lucas wearing his [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Lucas (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{barry_(pokemon) pokemon_platinum}}
** Barry wearing his [i]Platinum[/i] outfit. See [[Barry (pokemon)|]] for details.

h5. A note about the anime

* {{pokemon_dppt_(anime) winter_clothes}}
** Dawn wears winter clothes in the [i]Diamond & Pearl[/i] anime series too.
** Example: post #464226.
** In these cases, use [[pokemon dppt (anime)]] and [[winter clothes]] (don't use any game tags like [[pokemon platinum]] or [[pokemon dppt]]).

h4. Characters introduced in [i]Platinum[/i]

These characters were introduced in [i]Platinum[/i] and may be tagged [[pokemon platinum]] as well as [[pokemon dppt]].

They may appear in manga and anime, however. For posts exclusively referencing some manga or the anime, do not use any game tags like [[pokemon platinum]] or [[pokemon dppt]].

h5. Frontier Brains

title: victini
body:
[[pokemon|Pok√©mon]] #494 in the National Pok√©Dex, a dual type Fire/Psychic Mythical Pok√©mon. 
The first announced secret legendary (mythical) of [[Pokemon BW|Pok√©mon Black and White]], similar to [[Mew (pokemon)|]], [[Celebi]], [[Jirachi]], and [[Manaphy]]. Notably the first Pok√©mon to come before the starter Pok√©mon in a regional Pok√©dex, at #000 in the Unova region. Its name may be derived from its v-shaped ears and/or the [[v|victory sign]] it gives in official art.

Japanese Name: [b]Victini[/b]

Prior Pok√©mon: [[Arceus]]
Next Pok√©mon: [[Snivy]]

title: johanna_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Ayako[/b] (Japanese), [b]Johanna[/b] (English)

[[Pokemon DPPT]] character.

In the game, she is the mother of the player character, [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] or [[Lucas (pokemon)|]]. She is an accomplished Pok√©mon Coordinator from Twinleaf Town.

In the [[Pokemon DPPT (anime)|anime]], she is the mother of [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] and appears as a recurring character.

In the [[Pokemon Adventures]] manga, she is the mother of [[Lucas (pokemon)|Diamond]].

h4. See also

* [[list of families of pokemon main characters|List of families of Pok√©mon main characters]]
* [[list of pokemon characters|List of Pok√©mon characters]]

title: pachirisu
body:
[[pokemon|Pok√©mon]] #417 in the National Pok√©dex, an Electric type Pok√©mon.

Pachirisu is a small, white squirrel-like Pok√©mon with a faint blueish tint and a light blue stripe starting from its forehead and goes all the way down to the tip of the tail.

Despite being generally a weak Pok√©mon, it was famously used to great effect by [[Se Jun Park]] in the [[Video Game Championships 2014]].

Japanese Name: [b]Pachirisu[/b]

Prior Pok√©mon: [[Vespiquen]]
Next Pok√©mon: [[Buizel]]

title: pokemon_showdown!
body: Fan-made competitive [[Pokemon]] battle simulator run by Smogon University.

title: fairy_tale_girl_(pokemon)
body:
A type of trainer class in the [[pokemon|Pokemon games]], introduced in [[Pokemon XY]].

Seen with and specializes in Fairy-type Pokemon. Occasionally paired with the [[Hex Maniac (pokemon)|]] due to an in-game trainer pair called the Mysterious Sisters.

h4. See also

* [[List of Pokemon characters]]

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Fairy Tale Girl (Trainer class)":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Fairy_Tale_Girl_%28Trainer_class%29

title: pokemon_swsh
body:
[i]Pokemon Sword and Pokemon Shield[/i] are the first games in the eighth generation of the [[Pokemon|Pok√©mon]] series, released for the [[Nintendo Switch]] in November 2019. The games take place in the Galar Region, based on England.

[b]Use [[Pokemon SwSh]] only for human characters, not for Generation VIII Pokemon by themselves[/b]. This includes personifications, dolls, etc. For example, post #3429705 is just a Scorbunny, so it shouldn't be tagged [[Pokemon SwSh]].

See [[help:pokemon tags|Help:Pok√©mon tags]] for more tagging guidelines.

title: se_jun_park
body: South Korean competitive [[Pokemon]] player. Famous for winning [[Video Game Championships 2014]], using a [[Pachirisu]] as a support tank. His avatar in the championship wore the black fedora and black feather.

title: sakura_miko_(1st_costume)
body:
The current default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Sakura Miko]]. Designed by [[Amagai Tarou]], it was revealed Christmas 2020, replacing her original model as her default.

It's a [[nontraditional miko]] costume consisting of a [[frilled kimono|frilled]] [[sleeveless kimono|sleeveless]], [[backless kimono|backless]]/[[sideless kimono|sideless]] [[kimono]] top with a conventional shirt collar and a red [[tassel]], [[white sleeves|white]] [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]] with a [[hip vent]], a red [[thigh strap]] on one leg and a [[frilled thigh strap]] on the other [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[tabi]] (a [[white socks|white]] [[single sock|sock]] and a [[white thighhighs|white]] [[lace-trimmed thighhighs|lace-trimmed]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]]) and [[geta]].

For her original default costume, see [[Sakura Miko (old design)]].

title: todd_snap
body:
[b]Tooru[/b] (Japanese), [b]Todd Snap[/b] (English)

[[Pokemon]] character. In the games, he is the protagonist of [[Pokemon Snap]], a Nintendo 64 game released in 1999. In [[New Pokemon Snap]], he assists the player in conducting an ecological survey of the Lental region.

In the [[pokemon (classic anime)|classic anime]], he appears as one of [[Ash Ketchum]]'s companions.

title: gold_ship_(umamusume)
body:
[i][[Umamusume]][/i] character.

Gold Ship is the self-proclaimed [[pakatube|PR manager]] of the Umamusume franchise and a [[virtual youtuber]], active since March of 2018. 

As a popular character and her real-life lineage having some "serious implications":[/pools/17253] in the Uma-verse (for one thing, she would be related to the Mejiro family), she is often being portrayed as a [[aged down]] child, usually with her real-life birth color, which is chestnut.

Features something like an LCD touchscreen (used in-game via the [[Nintendo DS]]'s touchscreen), a variety of apps to aid Pok√©-management, and either one or two buttons to scroll through available apps.

title: pokemon_emerald
body:
The game [i]Pok√©mon Emerald[/i]. This is a subset of [[pokemon rse]] (Pok√©mon Ruby, Sapphire, and Emerald).

Use this tag only for things that appear in [i]Emerald[/i] but don't appear in [i]Ruby and Sapphire[/i]. This includes some [i]Emerald[/i]-exclusive characters and designs.

This tag is similar to [[pokemon platinum|Pok√©mon Platinum]].

h4. Outfits

* {{may_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** May wearing her [i]Emerald[/i] outfit. See [[May (pokemon)|]] for details.
* {{brendan_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** Brendan wearing his [i]Emerald[/i] outfit. See [[Brendan (pokemon)|]] for details.

h5. A note about the anime

* {{may_(pokemon) pokemon_dppt_(anime)}}
** May wears the same outfit in the [i]Diamond & Pearl[/i] anime series.
** Example: post #1100280.
** In these cases, use [[pokemon dppt (anime)]] (don't use any game tags like [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]]).

h4. Exclusive characters / roles

These are characters or roles exclusive to [i]Pok√©mon Emerald[/i]. They don't appear in any other games (outside of cameos).

They may however appear in manga and anime. For posts exclusively referencing some manga or the anime, don't use any game tags like [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]].

h5. Gym Leader

* [[Juan (pokemon)|]], the Gym Leader of Sootopolis City in [i]Pok√©mon Emerald[/i]. He does not appear in [i]RS[/i] or [i]ORAS[/i].

h5. Champion

* {{wallace_(pokemon) pokemon_emerald}}
** Wallace is the Hoenn Champion [i]Pok√©mon Emerald[/i]. So posts where he fills that role in a game context (as opposed to manga/anime context) such as post #753097 are tagged [[pokemon emerald]].

h5. Frontier Brains

* [[Anabel (pokemon)|]]
* [[Brandon (pokemon)|]]
* [[Greta (pokemon)|]]
* [[Lucy (pokemon)|]]
* [[Noland (pokemon)|]]
* [[Spenser (pokemon)|]]
* [[Tucker (pokemon)|]]

h5. A note about Pok√©mon SM

* {{anabel_(pokemon) pokemon_sm}}
** In [[pokemon sm|Pok√©mon Sun and Moon]], [[Anabel (pokemon)|]] appears with long hair tied in a ponytail (as opposed to her short hair in [i]Emerald[/i]), and using a black coat and tie. In these cases, use [[pokemon sm]], not [[pokemon emerald]] or [[pokemon rse]].

title: bonnie_(pokemon)
body:
[[Pokemon XY]] character.

In the [[Pokemon XY|game]], she is [[Clemont (pokemon)|]]'s little sister and assistant. She can assess how well the player has bonded with their Pok√©mon in [[Pokemon-Amie]].

In the [[Pokemon XY (anime)|anime]], she travels with [[ash ketchum|Ash]] in the Kalos region. An energetic and cheerful little girl who eagerly looks forward to the day she can become a Pok√©mon Trainer. This led her to ask her brother, [[Clemont (pokemon)|]], to let her "keep" the [[Dedenne]] that had been following them since they left Lumiose City. For some reason, she is also looking for a bride for her big brother. She will often ask young women if they will marry him, embarrassing Clemont to no end.

title: zekrom
body:
[[pokemon|Pok√©mon]] #644 in the National Pok√©Dex, a dual type Dragon/Electric Legendary Pok√©mon.
Zekrom is a black, bipedal Pok√©mon resembling a dragon or dinosaur, with dark patches on various portions of its body. It has red scleras, white irises, and black pupils, as well as a small horn-like protrusion on the tip of its snout. Its head sports a thundercloud-like crest tipped with light-blue coloration. There are six pairs of pointed teeth visible when its mouth is open, two in the upper jaw and four in the lower. At the base of its neck is a black, stud-like feature, and atop its shoulders are similar, larger features resembling armor padding. The bases of its wings also have such padding, and a fanned, splayed, seemingly webbed shape with a small "wing-spike" on one edge. The lower length of Zekrom's arms extenuate into splayed, seemingly webbed, somewhat baseball-mitt-like formations, with three-clawed, dark-colored hands on the undersides. The front portion of Zekrom's waist is black-colored, with its belly and thighs having thin striations down their length. Its knees are black, as are the foremost parts of its three-clawed feet and spiked heels.
It appears on the box art of [[Pokemon BW|Pok√©mon White]]. 

Alongside [[Reshiram]] and [[Kyurem]] it is part of the "Tao Trio":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Tao_trio.

It does not evolve from or into another Pok√©mon.
Japanese Name: [b]Zekrom[/b]

Prior Pok√©mon: [[Reshiram]]
Next Pok√©mon: [[Landorus]]

title: swim_swim
body: Character from [[Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku]]. "Swim Swim" is the name of the magical girl form of [[Sakanagi Ayana]]. As a magical girl she has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[drill hair|drill]] sidelocks and [[pink eyes]]. She wears [[bunny headphones]] on her head and [[goggles]] [[goggles around neck|around her neck]]. Her clothing consists mostly of a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[old school swimsuit|school swimsuit]], although she also wears a [[frills|frilled]] [[thigh strap]] around her left leg and [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]]. She has what appear to be [[bat wings]] on her back.

title: luigi_torelli_(kancolle)
body:
Italian submarine Luigi Torelli, the fourth Marconi-class submarine, as depicted in [[Kantai Collection]], named after Italian scientific fellow and patriot "Luigi Torelli (9 February 1810 ‚Äì 14 November 1887)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luigi_Torelli].

In-game, because of having a male name (and also sharing a name with [[Luigi|a certain plumber]]), she calls herself "Lu."

She is depicted as a [[flat_chest|flat-chested girl]] with [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[green eyes]] wearing initially a white [[hairband]] and black [[thighhighs|thigh-high boots]]. She wears a grey thigh-length [[sleeveless]] and skirted [[wetsuit]] with green accents. Her garb changes with each remodel: As [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25]] (or "Ui"), she gains [[arm warmers]], red, white, and black shoulder pads, and a black hairband. Then, upon becoming [[i-504 (kancolle)|I-504]] (or "Go"), she reverts to her white hairband, but is otherwise reduced to nothing else but a [[white one-piece swimsuit|white]] [[school swimsuit]]. Despite the changes in wardrobe, her standard submarine [[machinery]], with its grey and green livery, mostly stays the same.

Luigi Torelli has the unique distinction in the game as the shipgirl to serve all three Axis powers, representing one of the two ships that ever did so (the other being another Italian submarine [[Comandante Cappellini (kancolle)|]]). The historical submarine originally patrolled the Mediterranean Sea, sinking and damaging Greek and British commercial ships before surviving an attack by Vickers Wellington bombers using Leigh light on June 3, 1942. Due to her dimensions, she was deemed fit for long travels and thus was among seven submarines sent to the Far East in 1943, retaining her Italian crew despite being under Kriegsmarine command. After the new Italian government signed an armistice with the Allies the same year, the historal [i]Luigi Torelli[/i] was passed to full German command under the name [i]U.IT.25[/i] and took part in German war operations in the Pacific. After Germany's surrender in 1945, ex-[i]Luigi Torelli[/i]'s IJN custodians then took over control, renaming her [i]I-504[/i]. She was under the Japanese flag when she shot down a B-25 Mitchell bomber near the very end of the World War II in the Pacific, allegedly the last Axis naval success. She was captured by American forces in Kobe at the conclusion of the war and eventually scuttled by the US Navy in the Kii Channel on April 16, 1946.

h4. See also

* [[uit-25 (kancolle)|U.IT.25 (Kantai Collection)]] 
* [[I-504 (kancolle)|]]

h4. External links

* "Kancolle Wiki: Luigi Torelli":[https://kancolle.fandom.com/wiki/Luigi_Torelli]
* "Wikipedia: Italian submarine Luigi Torelli":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italian_submarine_Luigi_Torelli]

title: school_swimsuit
body:
A standard school-issued [[one-piece swimsuit]] usually blue, black, white or grey in color sometimes with the wearer's name written or printed on a white [[name tag]] stitched across the chest. The style has evolved over the years.

The original [[old school swimsuit]] has thicker shoulder straps, vertical seams over torso and a [[school swimsuit flap|flap]] over the groin.

The [[new school swimsuit]] is identical in style to the old school swimsuit except with no flap over the groin.

The [[competition school swimsuit]] has thinner shoulder straps, is unseamed and has no flap over the groin. It is closer in style to the more modern [[competition swimsuit]], but still in the style of a school swimsuit.

The [[nontraditional school swimsuit|non-traditional school swimsuit]] is a swimsuit that has been patterned after a school swimsuit, but is two-piece, frilled, or has other alterations to it that deviate from the norm.


h4. Examples

* !post #7165220

h4. See also

* [[one-piece swimsuit]]

title: stellus_keirich
body:
[b]Takeyama Hoshi[/b] (Á´πÂ±±„Åª„Åó), born [b]Stellus Keirich[/b], is a character from [[Jo Shin Ogi]]'s [i][[Chronicle of Myers]][/i], appearing in [i]Invasion to Shadowlands[/i], [i]Keirichlied[/i] and [i]Vater des Sterns[/i]. An Austrian-Japanese idol, guitarist and vocalist, she is the daughter of [[Albert Keirich]], and the first LGBTQ+ character in the series. Her alias is Hoshino Taichi (ÊòüÈáéÂ§™‰∏Ä).

She has a wife, [[Hoshino Ryoko (Chronicle of Myers)|]], both members of the group HOSIBOSI. and parent of [[Hoshino Atsuko (Chronicle of Myers)|]] (later Hoshino Kadosada).

She's first Death Knight character from [i][[Chronicle of Myers]][/i].

[spoilers]Born a man, Stellus was condemned dead at birth, but his father, Albert Keirich, could not bear his death. In order to change the situation, Albert resurrected him with magical music. But it came at a price... the dead Stellus opened his eyes after being resurrected, but the magic had forcibly turned him [[undead|into a woman]].

When trying to tagging Stellus, [[1girl]] is commonly used, but if it is based on gender at birth or soul form, it can be [[1boy]], [[old man]], and [[ghost]].
[/spoilers]

Stellus is inspired in part by [[hoshino aquamarine|Hoshino Aqua]] and [[hoshino ruby|Ruby]] (Aqua: 2/4, Ruby: 2/4, unisex, but idol form is Aqua: 1/4 and Ruby: 3/4), the children of [[Hoshino Ai]] in [i][[Oshi no Ko]][/i], [[Hoshikawa Lily]] (born gender, but stellus stay on the male identity) in [i][[Zombie Land Saga]][/i], and [[Darion Mograine]] (both are [[Death Knight]]) in [i][[World of Warcraft]][/i].

Her design in her debut game is based on the likeness of real-life [[idol]] Hashiguchi Erina, which primarily shows her either having [[twin braids]] or a [[short ponytail]]. title: valentina_(super_mario_rpg)
body:
An antagonist from [[Super Mario RPG]]. She attempted to take over Nimbus Land in the midst of it's missing prince, locking away the [[Queen_nimbus_(super_mario_rpg)|Queen]] and [[king_nimbus_(super_mario_rpg)|King]] in the process. After spreading a lie to the townsfolk that the King is sick she begins also telling them that [[Dodo_(super_mario_rpg)|]] is their lost prince, and both pretend to be betrothed to each other in order to officially make Valentina queen.

She has [[pink skin]] and a [[curvy|hourglass figure]]. She wears a [[yellow_dress|yellowish]] [[strapless dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]] as well as [[pink footwear]]. Her eyes are [[black eyes|black]] and her eyelids are covered in [[blue eyeshadow]]. She has a [[green_bird|green]] [[parrot]] [[bird_on_head|on her head]] in place of hair, a parrot which is said to be a homage to [[Squawks]] from [[Donkey Kong Country]] [tn]"[1]":[https://web.archive.org/web/20230623084403/https://twitter.com/kurashimakaz/status/1672059029865263104][/tn].

In the original [[Super Nintendo]] release her official render shows her having a [[black pantyhose]], but in the [[Nintendo Switch]] remake this was removed entirely to have her legs completely exposed.

In Japanese her name is literally [[Margarita]], in reference to the [[cocktail_glass|cocktail]] she holds in her hand.

title: samurai_jack_(character)
body: Samurai Jack, also known as The Samurai or simply Jack, is a sobriquet adopted by the titular protagonist of the Cartoon Network/Adult Swim animated television series [[Samurai Jack]] (2001‚Äì2004; 2017). He was created by Genndy Tartakovsky and is voiced by Phil LaMarr. The character is introduced as a Japanese prince raised since youth as a samurai warrior, who trains under several teachers in order to destroy the demon Aku with his father's sword. However, before he can kill Aku, the demon sends him into the future, where his future self rules over Earth, which has become a post-apocalyptic dystopia, unopposed. Adopting the alias "Jack", the samurai makes it his mission to find a way back to his time and prevent this future from happening.

title: earth_federation
body:
The planetary governmental body from the Universal Century based [[Gundam]] series. 

They first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] [[science fiction]] anime series from 1979 and are enemies of the Principality of [[Zeon]]. 

This organization was heavily inspired by the "Allies":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_II of World War II, and the [[united_nations|U.N.]], from [[real life]].
