title: youtube_creator_award
body:
[b]YouTube Creator Awards[/b] are a series of [[play button]]-plaques awarded by [[YouTube]] in recognition of popular channels and content creators. They are based on subscriber count, however not every channel which reaches the required level receives one, as YouTube grants them at its own discretion.

The current awards and their associated subscriber counts are:
* [b][[Silver Creator Award]][/b] - [u]100,000 Subscribers[/u]
** - Nickel alloy
* [b][[Gold Creator Award]][/b] - [u]One Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Gold-plated brass. This is the award most commonly depicted.
* [b]Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]Ten Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Silver-plated metal inset with colorless crystal glass in the shape of a play button triangle.
* [b]Custom[/b] (a.k.a. [b]Ruby[/b]) [b]Creator Award[/b] - [u]50 Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Design varies according to receipient.
** - 35 recipients as of October 2022
* [b]Red Diamond Creator Award[/b] - [u]100 Million Subscribers[/u]
** - Dark glass or metal with red Baccarat crystal (made of gold, barium oxide, and sand) in the shape of a play button triangle.
** - Only 10 recipients as of March 2024: [[PewDiePie]], "T-Series":https://www.youtube.com/user/tseries, "Cocomelon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cocomelon, "Sony Entertainment Television India":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_Entertainment_Television, [[MrBeast]], "Kids Diana Show":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kids_Diana_Show], "Like Nastya":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Like_Nastya], "Vlad and Niki":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vlad_and_Niki], "Zee Music Company":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zee_Music_Company], and [[WWE]].

h4. External links

* "Creator Awards for Subscriber Milestones - YouTube Creators":[https://www.youtube.com/creators/how-things-work/programs-initiatives/awards/]

title: lamar_roasts_franklin_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a cutscene from [[Grand Theft Auto V]] featuring [[Franklin Clinton]] and [[Lamar Davis]]. It takes place in the mission [i]Franklin and Lamar[/i] where Lamar retorts back to Franklin for not hanging out with him after finishing a repossession job. 

[quote]
Lamar: "Wassup, can a loc come up in your crib?"

Franklin: "Man, fuck you. I'll see you at work."

Lamar: "Ah, nigga don't hate me 'cause I'm beautiful nigga. Maybe if you got rid of that old yee-yee ass haircut you got you'd get some bitches on your dick. Oh, better yet, maybe Tanisha will call your dog ass if she ever stops fuckin' with that brain surgeon or lawyer she fucking with. Nigga...

Franklin: "...What?"
[/quote]

The scene went viral after some Japanese virtual youtubers unknowingly repeated Lamar's "nigga" without knowing its actual meaning, most notably [[Sakura Miko]] from [[Hololive]].

The meme later regained resurgence due to a series of videos featuring various other characters insulting Frankin's "yee-yee ass haircut" through mods and efforts of voice acting. This was later taken to a higher step where the voice actors for both Franklin and Lamar reenact the scene in real life.

The scene was later officially referenced of [i]The Contract[/i] DLC in [i]GTA Online[/i], though the word [i]nigga[/i] is sarcastically changed into [i]my politically incorrect racial epithets[/i] in response to the word's sensitive usage. The meme is taken even one step further with the actual voice actors (Shawn "Solo" Fonteno and Gerald "Slink" Johnson) recreating it in real life.

h4. External links
* "Know Your Meme: Lamar Roasts Franklin":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/lamar-roasts-franklin-yee-yee-ass-haircut]

body:
He is the main male protagonist for the bonus game in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]] series, [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: katsute shoujo datta kimi e|Katsute Shoujo Datta Kimi e]][/i], the third game of the series.

[b]Souta[/b] is the boyfriend of [[Inamori Haru]]. He works as a professional photographer.

title: inamori_haru
body:
She is the main female protagonist for the bonus game in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]] series, [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: katsute shoujo datta kimi e|Katsute Shoujo Datta Kimi e]][/i]. She also makes an appearance as a side character in other [b]Bishoujo Mangekyou[/b] games.

[b]Haru[/b] is the girlfriend of [[Kamijou Souta]]. She works as a [[waitress]] at a hot springs inn in the middle of the mountain's.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied in a [[single hair bun]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears an [[orange kimono]], green [[haramaki]], [[pink panties]], and white [[tabi]]s.

title: bishoujo_mangekyou:_katsute_shoujo_datta_kimi_e
body:
[b]Bishoujo Mangekyou: Katsute Shoujo Datta Kimi e[/b], is a bonus game in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou_(series)|]] series. In the middle of the mountains at an isolated rural hot springs inn, the beautiful waitress, [[Inamori Haru]], is visited by her secret lover, [[Kamijou Souta]], the lover of Haru. The couple interlocks in a steaming hot night of love...

title: hanazato_megumi
body:
A character in the second [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: wasurenagusa to eien no shoujo|Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo]][/i] (Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl).

[b]Megumi[/b] is one of [[Kanzaki Akihito]]'s childhood friends. She is an honor student who also enjoys watching as well as discussing anime.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[small breasts]].

title: sawatari_shizuku
body:
The main female protagonist in the second [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: wasurenagusa to eien no shoujo|Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo]][/i] (Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl).

[b]Shizuku[/b] is the childhood friend of [[Kanzaki Akihito]] who reunites with him after moving two years ago and not keeping in contact with him. She is a kind and energetic girl admired by everyone. Her hobbies and interests include rhythmic gymnastics and sweets, even though concerned about her weight.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[hair_flower|flower hair ornament]], [[green eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[striped necktie]], [[red skirt|red]] [[plaid skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[shoes]].

title: kanzaki_akihito
body:
The main protagonist in the second [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: wasurenagusa to eien no shoujo|Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo]][/i] (Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl).

After his childhood heart problems got worse, as time went on [b]Akihito[/b] refused to go to school and has turned into the opposite of his past social self, who used to be good at studying, exercising, and getting along with everyone. This changes when he is reunited with his childhood friend and crush [[Sawatari Shizuku]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. He wears a [[school uniform]]: [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] and [[black pants]].

title: bishoujo_mangekyou:_wasurenagusa_to_eien_no_shoujo
body:
[b]Bishoujo Mangekyou: Wasurenagusa to Eien no Shoujo[/b] [i](Bishoujo Mangekyou: Forgotten Grass & Eternal Girl)[/i], the second game in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou_(series)|]] series. It follows [[Kanzaki Akihito]], a young boy with heart problems. His mind was darkened mostly by his childhood friend and first love [[Sawatari Shizuku]], whom he feels betrayed by. As years pass Shizuku appears before Akihito and the story starts moving in a direction not one of them had expected.

title: kagarino_kirie
body:
The main female protagonist in [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: norowareshi densetsu no shoujo|Norowareshi Densetsu no Shoujo]][/i], the first title in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]] series.

At first glance, [b]Kirie[/b] is a beautiful student at an all-girls school that [[onogami shigehiko|Onogami]] teaches at, but secretly she is a 300+ year old [[vampire]] with an air of superiority. Being adamant in her opinion that humans are an inferior species. She keeps a calm and composed persona while also not speaking much in public.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] styled in [[twintails]] with [[choppy bangs]] and [[sidelocks]], [[red eyes]] ([[blue eyes]] in public), and [[small breasts]].

title: onogami_shigehiko
body:
The main protagonist in the first [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]], [i][[bishoujo mangekyou: norowareshi densetsu no shoujo|Norowareshi Densetsu no Shoujo]][/i] (A Girl's Cursed Legend).

[b]Onogami[/b] is a popular teacher at an all-girls school. While he made a vow never to lay hands on his students, he finds himself inexplicably attracted to [[kagarino kirie|Kirie]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[blazer]], black [[necktie]], and [[black pants]].

title: bishoujo_mangekyou:_norowareshi_densetsu_no_shoujo
body:
[b]Bishoujo Mangekyou: Norowareshi Densetsu no Shoujo[/b] [i](Bishoujo Mangekyou: A Girl's Cursed Legend)[/i] is the first game in the [[Bishoujo Mangekyou (series)|]] series, that follows [[Onogami Shigehiko]], a teacher at an all-girls school who has a secret, he loves beautiful young girls. He abstains from crossing the line with any of his students until he meets [[Kagarino Kirie]], a mysterious girl of stunning beauty. It is in this meeting that finally derails him into crossing that line, a line that was better left not crossed.

title: amano_pikamee
body:
A former bilingual Japanese [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], member of [[VOMS]]. 

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #3975769 for her original design, - for her dinosaur hood design, - for her VOMS Black design, post #5223579 for Isekai Pikamee, - for Isekai Kimono, and post #5701038 for Isekai Monster.[/tn]

She has received a number of design updates since her debut, generally coinciding with her anniversary - in March 2021, alongside updates for her regular Live2D, she received a second form, in which she wears a [[dinosaur hood]] and has shrunk to the size of a child (going from 135cm to around 90cm), while maintaining arm length. In March 2022, she received three more forms, the first, alongside everyone else in VOMS, this time themed around urban styling (referred to as VOMS Black), the second turning her into a child (referred to as Isekai Pikamee), and the third giving her new child look a kimono and long hair. Later, in September, she would receive another form for her child look, giving her a powered-up lightning monster form. Isekai Pikamee, in contrast to her other forms, was handled by an artist other than GYARI, that being [[Shiratama (shiratamaco)|]].

Pikamee announced her graduation on 1 March 2023, effective on 31 March.

title: kim_jae_hoon
body: Kim Jae Hoon is a character in the [[Fatal Fury]] series who debuted in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], the son of [[Kim Kaphwan]] and younger brother of [[Kim Dong Hwan]], trained in [[taekwondo]]. Of the brothers, Jae Hoon is the studious earnest champion of justice. He has [[blue hair]] and wears a white-and-green [[dobok]].

title: kim_dong_hwan
body: Kim Dong Hwan is a character in the [[Fatal Fury]] series who debuted in [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], the son of [[Kim Kaphwan]] and elder brother of [[Kim Jae Hoon]], trained in [[taekwondo]]. Of the brothers, Dong Hwan is the cocky talented slacker. He has [[short hair|short]], [[black hair]] and wears a black-and-red [[dobok]]. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], after a scolding by father Kim for being a little too irresponsible, Dong Hwan is taking things a little more seriously; in addition, he still wears his black-and-red dobok pants, but now he sports an exposed [[tank top]] with a [[jacket around waist|jacket tied around his waist]].

title: shiranui_mai
body:
A Japanese fire-wielding [[ninja]] from [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]] and later [[The King of Fighters]]. She debuted in [i]Fatal Fury 2[/i].

Her trademarks are her [[folding fan]], and her [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[Japanese clothes]] that show off her [[large breasts]], legs, and overall physique. She has [[brown eyes]] and most commonly wears her [[long hair|long]], [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]] tied up with an ornamental hairpin, usually referred to as a [[motoyui]].

Mai is the last native heir to Shiranui-ryuu Ninjutsu, with a particular skill in fire ninja magic. She has a loving infatuation with - and at least as of [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], is engaged to - fellow Shiranui-ryuu practitioner [[Andy Bogard]], whom she trained with at a relatively young age and she came to see as a good man (though she tended to move the relationship a little too quickly for Andy's liking). As of [[Garou: Mark of the Wolves]], she and Andy both train a young Shiranui-ryuu disciple named [[Hokutomaru]]. She is good friends with most of the rest of the Fatal Fury roster, not least of which includes Andy's brother [[Terry Bogard|Terry]] and best friend [[Joe Higashi]]. In The King of Fighters, she is a founding member of the Women Fighters Team alongside [[King (SNK)|]] and [[Yuri Sakazaki]].

Mai is one of SNK's most popular characters, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company rival is [[Capcom]]'s [[Street Fighter]]'s [[Chun-Li]]. She notably appears as a guest character in both [[Dead or Alive]] ([i]DOA 5 Last Round[/i] and [i]DOA 6[/i]) and [[Street Fighter 6]], being the second ever guest character (after [[Terry Bogard|Terry]]) to appear in a mainline Street Fighter title.

Due to her revealing attire, she was allegedly denied a cameo in [[Super Smash Bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]], since she would be challenging the game's [[CERO]] rating of A; the way Sakurai put it in the announcement ("[[Smash is for good boys and girls]]") was turned into a meme. She received a new outfit with her appearance in [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]]. The [[tank top]] and [[short shorts]]/[[dolphin shorts]] casualwear/nightwear she wore in her [[SNK Heroines: Tag Team Frenzy|SNK Heroines]] ending, previously referenced in her and Andy's Real Bout Fatal Fury 2 endings, makes a cameo appearance as part of her character select animation in [[Street Fighter 6]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4379718: Classic Mai (one of a few variations)
* !post #8044136: Time-skip Mai
* !asset #24628215: SNK Heroines ending

h4. See also

* [[Akiman pose]]

title: virtual_youtuber
body:
A [b]Virtual YouTuber[/b], sometimes called [b]VTuber[/b], is a content creator and personality that utilizes a 3D or 2D digital avatar for online videos and/or [[livestream]]ing, often assuming a character as well. Despite the name, content is not limited to [[YouTube]], and often, a VTuber is someone who declares themselves as such.

The term was first popularized by [[Kizuna Ai]], who called herself "the world's first virtual YouTuber". Many others followed suit, and the explosion in popularity of the practice lead the term to be used even outside of [[YouTube]], though variations on the term have been introduced as to diminish the use of the brand name, including "VTuber", "Virtual Singer"/"VSinger" (for those that exclusively do music, not be confused with [[VSinger (Vocaloid)|Vocaloid China]]), and "Virtual Liver"/"VLiver" (specifically referring to virtual streamers) or "Virtual Streamer"/"VStreamer" (due to the former term reminding folks of the organ in English). In Chinese, the term "Virtual Uploader"/"VUP" is used more commonly alongside "VTuber", after being first coined by [[Xiao Xi]] on [[Bilibili]]. In English, terms such as "PNGTuber" and "GIFTuber" also exist to refer to VTubers whose models use those formats, now that they are no longer the norm among indies (that had no access to 3D models back in the day). In Japan, the term "VLiver" is also used to refer creators and companies in the 'walled garden app' niche, such as [[IRIAM]] and [[AniLive]], apps which viewers use to watch VTubers who stream exclusively on them.

This tag should apply to not only virtual YouTubers themselves, but also to [[parody|parodies]] of virtual YouTubers, references to them, fictitious virtual YouTubers, fake virtual YouTubers, and concept art that ultimately isn't used (for the latter three, [code]original[/code] should be used). While tagging mascots and staff with the tag is fine, family members and friends of VTubers don't apply, unless they too are VTubers, nor do things merely associated with VTubers.

h4. See also 

* [[Indie Virtual YouTuber]] (for use with solo indies)
* [[utaite]]

body:
([i]Jouba[/i] machine)

A machine that simulates the effects of [[horseback riding]]. Exercises seldom used muscles in the dorsal and abdominal regions.

Although not intended for sexual use, it was suggestively and famously featured in several fanmade [[Idolmaster]] videos. 

Not to be confused with a [[mechanical bull]], which is a similar concept, but considerably more vigorous (and would make a poor sex toy on account of its habit of flinging its rider to the floor). Also not be confused with a [[Sybian]], which IS for sexual use and only borrows the straddling position of a riding machine.

title: tezuka_osamu
body:
[b]Tezuka Osamu[/b] (born 3 November 1928 ‚Äì 9 February 1989) was a legendary artist and mangaka. Also known as the [b]God of Manga[/b] ([i]"Manga No Kami-Sama"[/i]) and the [b]Godfather of Anime[/b]. Said to be responsible for the "big wide eyes" (actually inspired by Tezuka's admiration to the works of Walt [[Disney]]) and [[bishounen]] artstyle of characters that has prevailed in anime and manga up to these days.

Creator of [[Tetsuwan Atom]], [[Magma Taishi]], [[Jungle Taitei]], [i][[Pluto (tetsuwan atom)|]][/i], [[Metropolis]], [[Black Jack (series)|]], [[Don Dracula]], [[Buddha (tezuka osamu)|]], [[Adolf (tezuka osamu)|]], [[Hi no Tori]], [[Ribbon no Kishi]], [[Dororo_(tezuka)|]] and many many other classic manga, all considered part of [[Tezuka's Star System]].

Tezuka Osamu is by far the most prolific manga creator in the entire medium, having created about 700 different titles of original works. He has brought many conventions that have laid the foundations for many genres from shonen to seinen.

He graduated as a medical doctor, but never worked as such to focus in his mangaka work.

This tag is for the work done by Osamu, for posts that feature Osamu (and his self-insert), uses [[Tezuka Osamu (character)]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Tezuka Osamu (character)]]
* [[Tezuka Osamu (style)]]

title: otaku
body:
A person obsessed with any subject, whether anime, manga, [[comic]]s, entertainment, [[video game]]s, electronics, [[toy]]s, trains, vehicles, weapons, [[history]], etc.

The term started as a derogatory term in [[Japan]] during the late 70s towards anti-social people who are highly fixated over a particular subject or person, but has since evolved (in the West mostly) to imply a cool, eccentric individual with particularly unique hobbies or interests. However, depictions of generic otaku as an "unhealthily obsessive fan" stock character remains in widespread uses in media (specially in Japan). In the West, otaku are often conflated with Western nerds, to the point of the term being used as a synonym, but each have their own specific differences socially and culturally. For the purposes of Danbooru though, they are one and the same. 

Tag what you see: The tag is only applicable if the image shows their otakuness/nerdiness. 

h4. Notable characters

* [[Aida Kensuke]] ([[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]) 
* [[Daicon Bunny Girl]] ([[Daicon]])
* [[Hashida Itaru]] ([[Steins;Gate]])
* [[Helen (rpo)|]], [[Toshiro (rpo)|]], [[Samantha Cook]], [[Wade Owen Watts]] ([[Ready Player One]])
* [[Uchida Mamoru]] ([[Perfect Blue]])

* [[Kubo Ken]], [[Otaking (Otaku No Video)|]], [[Tanaka (Otaku No Video)|]] ([[Otaku no Video]])

h5. Specific kind of otaku

title: the_croods
body: The Croods (also known as Crood Awakening) is a 2013 American animated adventure comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by 20th Century Fox. The film was directed by Chris Sanders and Kirk DeMicco, both of whom also wrote the screenplay and were credited with conceiving the story alongside John Cleese. The film stars the voices of [[Nicolas Cage]], [[Emma Stone]], [[Ryan Reynolds]], Catherine Keener, Clark Duke, and Cloris Leachman. The film is set in a fictional prehistoric Pliocene era known as "The Croodaceous" (a prehistoric period which contains fictional creatures, most of which are hybrids of existing animals, like the Cockrat, and some may be original.) when Grug, patriarch of the Croods, is threatened by the arrival of a genius named Guy, who comes up with revolutionary new inventions as they trek through a dangerous but exotic land in search of a new home.

title: monsters_vs._aliens
body: Monsters vs. Aliens is a 2009 American animated science fiction comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by Paramount Pictures. The film was directed by Conrad Vernon and Rob Letterman from a screenplay written by Letterman, Maya Forbes, Wally Wolodarsky, and the writing team of Jonathan Aibel and Glenn Berger based on a story by Vernon and Letterman. Featuring the voices of Reese Witherspoon, Seth Rogen, Hugh Laurie, Will Arnett, Kiefer Sutherland, Rainn Wilson, [[Paul Rudd]], and Stephen Colbert, the film involves a group of misfit monsters hired by the United States Armed Forces to stop the invasion of an extraterrestrial villain and save the world in exchange for freedom.

title: over_the_hedge
body: Over the Hedge is a 2006 American animated heist comedy film produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation SKG. Based on the comic strip of the same name, the film was directed by Tim Johnson and Karey Kirkpatrick from a screenplay by Len Blum, Lorne Cameron, David Hoselton and Kirkpatrick, and features the voices of Bruce Willis, Garry Shandling, Steve Carell, [[William Shatner]], Wanda Sykes and Nick Nolte. Set in Indiana, the plot follows RJ, a raccoon who is forced to deliver food to a bear named Vincent after accidentally destroying his stockpile of food, whereupon he manipulates a family of woodland animals who have recently awakened from hibernation into helping him steal food in order to speed up the process.

title: mihama_private_academy_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by students of Mihama Private Academy from the [[Grisaia (series)|Grisaia series]]. 

The female uniform typically consists of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with [[white sailor collar]] and [[red bowtie|red]] or [[blue bowtie|blue]] [[plaid bowtie]] or [[blue necktie|blue]] [[plaid necktie]]. Worn over the shirt is a typically [[short dress|short]], [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[black dress|black]] and [[blue dress|blue]], [[sleeveless dress]] with [[double-breasted]] buttons.

The male uniform typically consists of a [[short sleeves|short sleeved]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] [[plaid necktie]], and [[black pants]].

title: i-203_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese submarine [i]I-203[/i]. Nicknamed "Fuumii". Character design by [[Hoshiakari_(c2_kikan)|]], voiced by [[Yamada Yuuki (voice Actor)|]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with long [[sidelocks]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a two-piece [[nontraditional school swimsuit]]: [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] with a [[white sailor collar|white]] [[sailor collar]] and a [[white neckerchief]], and a short dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pencil skirt]] that conceals the lower half of a school swimsuit. She also wears [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]] that bear her name. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces held by straps to her sides, and [[dual wielding|two]] 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s as [[handgun]]s. 

She made an initial appearance in the "May page of the 2021 Kancolle Calendar":[/posts/4272300] alongside [[I-47_(kancolle)|]] before being formally introduced into the game through the 2021 Spring Event.

body:

title: spider-man_(toei)
body:
A 1978 live-action [[tokusatsu]] show loosely based on the [i][[Spider-Man (series)|]][/i] series, produced by Toei Company, Ltd, following in the vein of [i][[Kamen Rider]][/i] and the Ishinomori [i][[Super Sentai]][/i] seasons. The series follows a man named [[Yamashiro Takuya]], who transforms into the titular "Emissary from Hell" to fight villains with his [[mecha]] [[Leopardon]].

Toei would later reuse the concept of heroes and mecha for [i][[Super Sentai]][/i] series that would follow this show, starting with [i][[Battle Fever J]][/i], also co-produced with Marvel (along with [i][[Denshi Sentai Denziman]][/i] and [i][[Taiyou Sentai Sun Vulcan]][/i] after).

This series' version of Spider-Man made an appearance in the [i][[Spider-Verse (comics)|]][/i] comic events, and is slated to appear in the sequel to [i][[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]][/i]. In his appearance in 2025's [i]Spider-Verse vs. Venomverse #3[/i], he would receive a brand new Ishinomori-inspired design. He's also frequently referred to by Western fans as [i]Supaidaman[/i].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man (Japanese TV series)":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_(Japanese_TV_series)

title: dr._ratio_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]] in Japanese. 

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. His default outfit is [[greco-roman clothes|Greco-Roman]] in style and comprises a [[black shirt]] top, [[white tunic]] with the Intelligentsia Guild's badge on the left breast side, [[blue pants]], and golden [[sandals]]. Often carrying his [[dr._ratio's_book_(honkai:_star_rail)|signature book]].

h4. Costumes
* !post #7691400: Splash art
* !post #7977851: [[Dr. Ratio (Academia) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Academia]]
* !post #7848610: [[Dr. Ratio (Final Victor) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Final Victor]]
* !post #9062733: [[Dr. Ratio (Star Rail Live 2025) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Star Rail Live 2025]]

His Chinese name ÁúüÁêÜÂåªÁîü can be translated as Dr. Reason. Much like [[Dan Heng (Imbibitor Lunae) (Honkai: Star Rail)|"Imbibitor Lunae"]], Dr. Ratio's name is also taken from Latin, with "Ratio" meaning "Reason".

In some languages of the game, his name is Dr. Truth instead, which is an [i]acceptable[/i] translation though "Truth" is generally shown as ÁúüÁõ∏ and not as ÁúüÁêÜ which is what they use for his name. According to early leaks, his name was originally going to be "Doctor of Truth".

His full name is [spoiler]Veritas Ratio[/spoiler], which is Latin for [spoiler]Truth Reason[/spoiler].

h4. Profile
[expand]
"The most annoying thing about idiocy is that you can't explain it to an idiot."

A candid and self-centered Intelligentsia Guild member, who often conceals his appearance with a strange plaster sculpture. He demonstrated unparalleled intelligence and talent since his youth, but now refers to himself as a "Mundanite."

He firmly believes that intellect and creativity are not confined to geniuses. He seeks to distribute knowledge to the entire universe to cure the persistent disease named ignorance.
[/expand]

title: trina_(nikke)
body:
A character from [[Goddess of Victory: NIKKE]]. A member of [[Botanic Garden (nikke)|]] along with [[Flora (nikke)|]]. 

Not only does she care for the trees she is responsible for, but she also embraces all living beings with a motherly affection.
While she may appear mature, she often displays a charmingly naive side in everyday situations. According to Flora, She has a tendency to [[undressing|shed her clothing]].

She has [[long hair|long]], [[white hair|white]], [[messy hair]] that's littered with [[leaf on hair|leaves]], [[purple eyes]] with [[white eyelashes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[virgin killer sweater|virgin killer]] [[sweater]] with a [[birch tree]] [[tree print|pattern]] that has a [[cleavage cutout]] and a [[navel cutout]]. title: lowrider
body:
A [[car]] specially modified so that it sits very low to the ground, originating in the Mexican-American culture of California.

Lowriders often also sport highly ornamental wheels (typically with wire spokes) and/or body work, showing off the individual owner's work on the vehicle, as well as hydraulic suspension systems that allow the driver to control the ride height or even bounce the vehicle around.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lowrider":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lowrider]

title: the_boss_baby
body: The Boss Baby is a 2017 American animated spy comedy film, produced by [[DreamWorks]] Animation and distributed by [[20th_century_studios|20th Century Fox]]. Loosely based on the 2010 picture book of the same name by Marla Frazee, it was directed by Tom McGrath from a screenplay by Michael McCullers, and stars the voices of Alec Baldwin as the title character, along with Steve Buscemi, Jimmy Kimmel, Lisa Kudrow, Miles Bakshi, and [[Tobey Maguire]]. The first installment in The Boss Baby franchise, the plot follows a boy helping his baby brother who is a secret agent in the war for adults' love between babies and puppies.

title: creedence_clearwater_revival
body:
[b]Creedence Clearwater Revival[/b] was an American rock band composed of lead vocalist, lead guitarist, and primary songwriter John Fogerty, his brother, rhythm guitarist Tom Fogerty, bassist Stu Cook, and drummer Doug Clifford. The band began in 1959 as the Blue Velvets before settling with their current name in 1967. After producing several hit songs, the band disbanded in 1972 due to animosity and disagreements between the band members.

The band's most famous song was their 1969 hit song, "[I]Fortunate Son[/I]", released during the growing backlash against America's involvement in the [[Vietnam War]].

title: clover_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Clover[/b] („Ç™„Çø„Ç±, Otake) is a character in [i][[Pokemon Legends: Arceus|Pok√©mon Legends Arceus]][/i]. She is the middle sister of the Miss Fortunes.

[spoiler]Clover is a former member of both the Diamond Clan and the Galaxy Expedition Team.[/spoiler]

Clover has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in [[twintails]], [[brown eyes]], and [[small breasts]] or [[flat chest]]. Her [[makeup]] includes [[red eyeshadow|red]] and [[blue eyeshadow]]. She wears rounded [[triangle earrings]], a [[sarashi]], an [[open jacket|open]] and [[torn jacket|torn]] [[blue jacket]] and a [[torn skirt|torn]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[miniskirt]], both resembling the [[Ginkgo Guild uniform]], a [[brown belt]], [[black shorts|black]] [[bike shorts under skirt|bike shorts under her skirt]], and [[black footwear|black]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[boots]] from the [[Diamond Clan outfit]]. She also carries small bags similar to carried by the Ginkgo Guild.

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Clover":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Clover]

title: sheik
body:
The ninja-like alter ego of [[Princess Zelda]] in [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time]][/i]. Also playable in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]][/i]

Zelda assumed this identity to be able to assist Link as he goes through his journey, and to better be able to combat [[Ganondorf]]'s forces during his reign of terror. In this form, Sheik is one of the last remaining members of the [[Sheikah]] tribe, and a mysterious and stoic individual. Sheik is also [[reverse trap|assumed to be a man]].

title: keraha
body:
Female/27 years old.

Among the magician sisters who entered Grand Flores, she is the younger one and is skilled in frost magic. She followed her sister into the forest to take care of her sister who entered Grand Flores alone to learn magic. However, after seeing the flames that occurred in Grakqarak, she was shocked by the great fire and became obsessed with frost everything around her, thinking that she had to put out the fire. She also freezes living beings who approach nearby, mistaking them for trying to start a fire.

title: binoche
body:
Female/29 years old.

Among the magic sisters who entered Grand Flores, she is the older sister and is skilled in fire magic. She has a pure desire for magic and heads to Grand Flores alone for this purpose. However, she witnesses monsters crawling from the dark Thunderland and teleportation phenomena, and sets the forest on magical fire to stop them.

title: nise-shiki
body:
Nise Shiki (literally [b]Fake Shiki[/b]) is the true antagonist of the main story in [[Tsukihime]] PLUS-DISC, [i]"Alliance of Illusionary Eyes"[/i] (ÂπªË¶ñÂêåÁõü). 

Having the ability to "see" into the past of those he passes by, he becomes obsessed with [[Tohno Shiki]] after accidentally peering into his memories. He then begins impersonating Shiki and becomes a serial killer, finding life to be meaningless while testing [[Seo Akira]]'s future predictive ability.

His real name is never revealed.

title: callie_(agent_1_casual)_(splatoon)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[Splatoon (series)|]]'s [[Callie (splatoon)|]]. It was introduced in the single-player campaign of [[Splatoon 1]], where she wears a variant of the outfit featuring [[sunglasses]] while under the cover-name of [i]"Agent 1"[/i]. She also commonly wears it while not doing general idol-work.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25379780: Agent 1's dialogue icon from [[Splatoon 1|]].
* !asset #25379783: Developer sketch of Agent 1, from Splatoon 1's credits sequence. (This along with her dialogue icon, serves as the only official appearance for the costume in Splatoon 1).
* !asset #25115722: Callie as she appears in the outfit in [[Splatoon 2|]].
* !asset #25379762: Concept Art for the outfit from [i]"The Art of Splatoon 2"[/i] official artbook.

title: marie_(agent_2_casual)_(splatoon)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|official costume]] used by [[Splatoon (series)]]'s [[Marie (splatoon)|]]. It was introduced in the single-player campaign of [[Splatoon 1]], where she wears it while under the cover-name of [i]"Agent 2"[/i]. She also commonly wears it while not doing general idol-work.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25379781: Agent 2's dialogue icon from [[Splatoon 1|]]. (This serves as the only official appearance for the costume in Splatoon 1).
* !asset #25379764: Concept Art for the outfit from [i]"The Art of Splatoon 2"[/i] official artbook.
* !post #7316802: From the left: [[Marie (splatoon)|]] as she appears with this outfit, next to her sister [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] in her [[callie (agent 1 casual) (splatoon)|equivalent disguise]].

title: imperialdramon
body:
An Ultimate-level Ancient Dragon  [[Digimon (creature)|]]. Traditionally shown to evolve from [[Paildramon]], it is featured in [[Digimon Adventure 02]] as the Jogressed Partner Digimon of [[Motomiya Daisuke]] and [[Ichijouji Ken]]. Its title is "Ruling Emperor Dragon" (ÂêõËá®„Åô„ÇãÁöáÂ∏ùÁ´ú, [i]Kunrin-suru Koutei-Ryuu[/i]).

In all of its guises, Imperialdramon bears [[red eyes]] and [[white hair]].

Imperialdramon has a number of forms and variants.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode|Dragon Mode]] ‚Äî A quadrupedal [[dragon]] Digimon with huge, sharp claws [[claws]] on its forelegs, [[oversized wings|large]] [[wings]] and a [[cannon]] mounted on its back. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode|Fighter Mode]] ‚Äî A bipedal dragon Digimon that has assumed a humanoid stance. Its cannon has moved to its right arm, and it now boast humanoid hands. Free attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Paladin Mode|Paladin Mode]] ‚Äî A further evolution of Fighter Mode that has gained [[Omegamon]]'s power, channeled through the [[Omega Blade]] [[greatsword]] in its hand. Vaccine attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Dragon Mode (Black)|Dragon Mode (Black)]] ‚Äî A black-colored variant of Dragon Mode that has surrendered to its destructive urges. Notably, it has a [[blue tongue]] and palate. Virus attribute.
* [[Imperialdramon Fighter Mode (Black)|Fighter Mode (Black)]] ‚Äî A black-colored variant of Fighter Mode that has tamed the rampant power of its Dragon Mode and awakened to a heart of evil. It notably features its cannon on its left arm, of which it can extend its heat sinks to form a lance of energy. The crown on its head features a [[third eye]]. Virus attribute.

title: mini_wings
body:
[[Wings]] on the back that are smaller than usual.

h4. See also

* [[oversized wings]]

title: wings
body:
Refers to characters who either have, or wear as a fashion accessory, wings on their back. Not for birds.
h4. See also

** [[No wings]]
** [[Single wing]]

title: astel_naturalborn_of_the_void
body:
A [[monster|monstrous]] creature of large size, Astel, Naturalborn of the Void is a creature from outer space with [[multiple_wings|multiple]] [[oversized wings|large]] [[insect_wings]], housed in a [[skeleton]] of an unknown humanoid creature, the skull of which houses a large [[one-eyed|singular eye]].
It utilizes gravity and magic and its [[extra_arms|extra arms]], [[mandibles]] and [[scorpion_tail|scorpion-esque]] tail to attack its foes.

title: oversized_wings
body:
Refers to characters with [[wings]] that are either, or both:

* At least 3/4 of their body height.
* When spread, it is twice of the character's arms length.
* Has a large surface area.

title: public_restroom
body:
A [[bathroom]] in a public institution, which has multiple [[toilet]]s surrounded by stalls for privacy.

Please use [[bathroom]] for bathrooms found at homes

h4.See also
* [[restroom symbol]]
* [[squat toilet]]
* [[toilet stall]]
* [[urinal]]

title: toilet
body:
A plumbing fixture found in [[bathroom]]s used for [[scat|defecation]] and [[peeing|urination]].

For public areas ([[public restroom]]s) they may be found in [[toilet stall]]s.

h4. See also

* [[human toilet]]
* [[have to poop]]
* [[potty]] (child‚Äôs toilet)
* [[squat toilet]]
* [[urinal]] (for male urination)
* [[swirlie]]
* [[toilet sink combo]]
* [[toilet use]]
* [[restroom symbol]]
* [[toilet brush]]
* [[toilet paper]]
* [[toilet paper tube]]
* [[no toilet paper]]
* [[toilet seat]]

title: urinal
body:
A sanitary plumbing fixture for [[peeing]] only, almost exclusive used from a standing position. Most urinals are designed to be used by men. Women may be able to use male urinals albeit with a greater risk of the [[pee]] landing outside of the urinal.

Female and unisex urinals do exist however they are far less common. 

h4. See also

* [[toilet]]
* [[toilet use]]
* [[public restroom]]

title: pee_stain
body: Any article of clothing suspiciously [[wet]] or yellow from someone [[peeing self|peeing themselves]]. Includes cloth used for [[lying]] or [[sitting]] on; and any place one would intentionally [[pee]], such as the ground or [[public restroom]]. May include furniture.

title: bathroom
body:
A [[room]] in a residential home or apartment containing a [[toilet]] and [[sink]], and typically also a [[bathtub]] or [[shower_(place)|shower]].

Please use [[public restroom]] for bathrooms found in public spaces.

title: toilet_stall
body: A small cubicle enclosing a [[toilet]] in a public [[public restroom]]. They are intended to provide users with a sense of privacy, but some have gaps beneath the partitions that make [[voyeurism]] possible.

title: hudram
body:
One of the Dark Giants and antagonists in [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|]].

In terms of design and aesthetics, he is based on [[Hudra]].

title: darrgon
body:
One of the Dark Giants and antagonists in [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|]].

In terms of design and aesthetics, he is based on [[Darramb]].

title: evil_trigger
body:
An evil Ultraman, as well as the main antagonist of [[Ultraman Trigger (series)|]]: Episode Z. His human host is [spoiler]Tokioka Ryuichi/Zabil[/spoiler].

Much like how [[Ultraman Trigger]] is based on [[Ultraman Tiga|Tiga]], he is based on [[Evil Tiga]] from [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]].

title: kitamura_yuuichi_(jockey)
body:
[[Real Life]] Japanese [[jockey]]. Most famous for riding [[Chrono Genesis (racehorse)|]] and [[Croix du Nord (racehorse)|]].

He is sometimes referred to by the nickname "Desk (Êú∫)" by keiba fans after he infamously knocked over a desk at the inquiry room after being handed a 1 week suspension for improper crossing during a race, leading to his suspension being extended a week for bad behavior.

title: ultraman_decker
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Decker (series)|]]. His human host is [[Asumi Kanata]].

Much like how [[Ultraman Trigger]] resembles [[Ultraman Tiga]], he is based on [[Ultraman Dyna]], in terms of design and aesthetics.

h4. Forms

* [[Ultraman Decker (Flash Type)|Flash Type]]
* [[Ultraman Decker (Miracle Type)|Miracle Type]]
* [[Ultraman Decker (Strong Type)|Strong Type]]
* [[Ultraman Decker (dynamic Type)|Dynamic Type]]

h4. Weapons

* [[Ultra Dual Sword]]
* [[Decker Shield Calibur]]

title: akigumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Akigumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a long [[ponytail]], [[green eyes]], and a [[mole_under_eye|mole under her right eye]]. Due to historical confusion on what class she was in, she wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is a hybrid of the styles seen in the [i]Kagerou[/i]- and [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class: her bridge and foremast to her back with a 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]], a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

Due to her lines (and the fact that her crew illustrated the sinking [[Hornet (kancolle)|]] in the battle of the Santa Cruz Islands), she is often portrayed as a manga artist and is sometimes shown "being involved in doujinshi":/pools/9514. 

The historical [i]Akigumo[/i] was initially grouped with the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class by historians. This was due to her following the [i]-gumo[/i] naming scheme and because the [i]Kagerou[/i] and [i]Yuugumo[/i]-classes were quite similar in design. Researchers later found documents in 1994 indicating that she was actually meant to be the last of the [i]Kagerou[/i]-class. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #4153402: [[Akigumo Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]]

* !post #7446371: [[Akigumo Kai Ni (Race Queen) (kancolle)|Kai Ni Race Queen]]

title: 5-string_bass_guitar
body:
A [[bass guitar]] with 5 string instead of just the standard 4. As its [[7-string guitar]] counterpart, it most commonly features an extra low B string, making its standard tuning B-E-A-D-G (from lowest string to highest).

Notably used by [[Yahata Umiri]] from [[BanG Dream! It's MyGO!!!!!]].

title: karl_der_grosse_(fate)
body:
Ruler-class servant in [i][[Fate/EXTELLA LINK]][/i]. The [i]Fate[/i]-verse's true historical version of the King of Franks. The other [[charlemagne (fate)|Charlemagne]] is the incarnation of the fantasy stories surrounding him that were told long after his death.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Kazuhiko]]

* !post #3075439

title: sans_(undertale)
body:
A lazy [[skeleton]] in [[Undertale]]. Brother of [[Papyrus (undertale)|Papyrus]]. Speaks in the [[Comic Sans]] font. [spoiler]Final boss of the 'Genocide' route.[/spoiler]

He wears a [[blue jacket]]/[[blue hoodie|hoodie]], [[white shirt]], [[black shorts]], and [[slippers]], and is always [[grin]]ning in the game. [spoiler]In his battle as the final boss of the Genocide Route, he is seen with a distinct [[glowing eye|glowing left eye]] when using telekinesis, and fights with [[bone]]s and [[gasterblaster]]s as well. [/spoiler][spoiler]At one point during his battle, you're offered the option to spare him, which results in him killing you. In English, he exclaims "geeettttttt dunked on!!!", while in Japanese, he comments that all he did "was try to hug you...", "prompting differences":https://twitter.com/Zarla_S/status/1631924060878954496 in fanart based on the region.[/spoiler]

During the peak of the game's popularity, Sans gained [[meme]]tic status due to his association with edgy and angsty teens on the internet, as well as numerous fan games involving him that were usually cheaply made and unfairly hard. His fan-made alternate universe versions would similarly be swept up in memes.

h4.See also

* [[Tumblr Sexyman Tournament]]

title: spring_onion
body:
This tag is for the naganegi, Japanese long onion, a variety of Welsh onion, sometimes called a Japanese leek in English due to their similar appearance. It is a vegetable often depicted as being shaped like a Y; a white twig with two green branches.

[[Hatsune Miku]] and [[Farfetch'd]] are known to carry this.

title: bb_(swimsuit_mooncancer)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[bb (swimsuit mooncancer) (fate)|BB Swimsuit MoonCancer]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]].

Her hairstyle returns to normal, but the hair length grows significantly longer. She wears a black vampire-styled coat with a large popped collar, a [[white leotard]], a red bowtie, [[white gloves]], and red [[high heels]]. She is also accompanied by a series of demonic black, red and yellow tentacles [spoiler]due to the connection she made with Nyarlathotep[/spoiler]. She always wears this Ascension's swimsuit during her Noble Phantasm, Cursed Cutting Crater. While she is more playful in her first two Ascensions, she is evil in this one.

This tag can include her tanned and non-tanned variants.

title: bb_(swimsuit_mooncancer)_(first_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[bb (swimsuit mooncancer) (fate)|BB Swimsuit MoonCancer]] in her First Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She has her hair in a long single braid, and wears a backwards baseball cap with star pins attached to it. She wears a white bikini top, a yellow jacket tied beneath her breasts, a yellow miniskirt, grey knee socks, and white sneakers with the same star pins as her hat.

This tag can include her tanned and non-tanned variants.

title: bb_(swimsuit_mooncancer)_(second_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[bb (swimsuit mooncancer) (fate)|BB Swimsuit MoonCancer]] in her Second Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wears a hairband with long purple ribbons and five stars adorning it, similar to the five stars seen on an SSR Servant's card. She wears another purple ribbon as a bowtie with a star decoration, a purple bikini, fingerless black gloves, a purple beaded bracelet, small black shorts, a white belt, black toeless thighhighs, and purple high heel sandals.

This tag can include her tanned and non-tanned variants.

title: big_belly
body:
A [[stomach]] that is noticeably large, as if decisively full, [[fat]], or [[pregnant]]. Commonly used when depicting a character that has eaten a great deal of food ([[bloated]]). Not necessary when depicting [[pregnant|pregnancy]] unless the character's belly is very large even in spite of their current condition. Can be used in indecisive cases where it's not clear if the character is actually pregnant.

For a [[midriff]] that is only somewhat [[plump]] or flabby, use [[belly]] instead. Avoid using both [[belly]] and [[big belly]], as they generally do not overlap.

h4. See Also

* [[fat]]
* [[plump]]
* [[belly]]
* [[pregnant]]
* [[inflation]]

title: azki_(4th_costume)_(hololive)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[AZKi (hololive)|]], designed by [[Scottie (phantom2)|]] and unveiled in her fourth anniversary live.

It consists of a [[white dress|white]] [[collared dress|collared]] [[high-low dress]] with [[puffy sleeves|puffy]] [[three-quarter sleeves]] a [[pink dress|pink]] [[gradient dress|gradient]] on one side and a [[grey dress|grey]] gradient with [[vertical-striped dress|vertical stripes]] on the other with a [[white skirt|white]] [[skirt under dress|skirt underneath]], a [[white ascot]], a [[brown jacket|brown]] half-jacket, a [[black sash]] with a [[waist bow]] and [[black boots|black]] [[high heel boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[very long hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[double-parted bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and a [[half updo]] tied into a [[half up half down braid]] that turns into a [[short ponytail]], decorated with a [[hairclip]] with a [[hair flower|flower]], she also has [[pink hair|pink]] [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] in addition to the  [[colored inner hair]] from her previous model.

She retained her distinctive pink [[facial mark]]s beneath her eyes up until April 2022 (coinciding with her official transfer to hololive), when it was replaced with a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8196884: Profile

Images that apply for this tag often feature complex architecture (think buildings stacked on top of buildings, architecture featuring many shapes and small details, or with many decorative objects or things such as wires attached etc.) and/or environments with lots of objects and decoration strewn around.

title: elster_(signalis)
body:
[i]Designation: LSTR-512[/i]

Protagonist of [[SIGNALIS]].
German for "[[Magpie]]"

After her ship crash-lands on a remote, snow-covered planet, the [[android|Replika]] Elster sets out to look for her missing crew member. In her search she wanders through the ruins of a seemingly abandoned underground labor camp, surreal visions of cosmic horror, and flashbacks to a past that isn't hers. As the lines between reality and dream blur, Elster has to venture into the depths below the planet's surface to learn what has happened to her and why - but mysterious encoded radio signals and a Replika with dark intentions are not the only obstacles she has to overcome along the way.

title: whimstar_(infinity_nikki)
body:
The main collectible item in [[Infinity Nikki]]. They can be acquired by completing various puzzles, challenges, and activities throughout the game and are used to upgrade [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki's]] skills.

They resemble white [[star_(symbol)|stars]] wrapped in pink and purple [[yarn]].

title: moonlight_oath_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A limited time 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It could only be acquired by purchasing it from the cash shop.

The outfit includes a [[long_dress|long]] [[strapless dress]] colored in a [[gradient_dress|gradient]] from light to dark [[blue_dress|blue]] and decorated with ornate patterns and gold [[jewelry]], a white [[stole]], and an almost floor length [[see-through_veil|transparent]] [[white veil]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[brunette hair]] with [[long sidelocks]] and a [[braid]] that crosses the forehead.

It has an alternate color evolution with a dark purple dress, purple veil, and blue hair.

title: afternoon_shine_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to catch bugs. It can be acquired by progressing the main story.

The outfit includes a gray or green [[sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] that end in [[frills]]. Worn over the sweater is a set of [[yellow overalls]] with frilled straps, [[pocket|pockets]], a [[flower brooch]], and a design of a [[bee_print|bee]] printed on the chest. For legwear it includes [[white_socks|white]] [[kneehighs|kneehigh socks]] trimmed with [[ribbon_legwear|ribbon]], and [[brown shoes]] with yellow laces. The outfit's hairstyle is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[parted bangs]] and a [[hair_flower|flower hair ornament]]. Accessories for the outfit include a [[yellow_hat|yellow]] [[sun_hat]] with a [[blue ribbon]] tied around it, which is worn on the back, and a [[butterfly net]] with the net actually shaped like a butterfly.

Has an alternate color evolution with black overalls, a white and orange striped shirt, and dark green hair.

title: bye-bye_dust_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to groom animals in order to collect resources from them. It can be acquired by advancing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue shirt]] with [[frilled_sleeves|frilled]] [[see-through_sleeves|transparent]] [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[yellow apron]] with a [[paw print]] decoration, [[blue shorts]] with a [[bubble print|bubble]] and [[water drop print|water drop]] pattern, a [[blue hat|blue]] [[frilled hat|frilled]] [[mob cap]] decorated with a [[bow]] and [[pom pom hat ornament]], [[short gloves|short]] [[frilled gloves|frilled]] [[blue gloves]], and [[yellow shoes]] with [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[pink socks]].

It has an alternate color evolution that is primarily black and white, with a pattern that resembles a cats fur.

body:
A Chinese web comic by Samanhua (È£íÊº´Áîª) and Tian Ping, and illustrated by [[Xiao Xiao Zuowen]]. Its English name is ‚ÄúBreaking Through 3000 A.D.‚Äù or ‚ÄúTravel to AD 3000‚Äù. 

The story is about [[Ye Bingyao]], a girl from the year 2011 who time-traveled to the year 3011, where androids that are indistinguishable from humans and humans with special powers have appeared. Caught within the conflict between various factions of the future, the girl struggles to be with the one she loves.

title: pickles_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Pickles[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. A black and white [[border collie]], Pickles possess a wiser and more philosophical mind compared to other dogs and humans. Pickles loves to talk about philosophy, but unable to express it because its fellow dogs are not as wise. Pickles receive a Dog Language-to-Human Language translator from [[Apple_(reverse:1999)|Mr. Apple]], although the translation result are sometimes different from what Pickles' mean. Pickles is one of the main character in the event [b]The Theft of the Rimet Cup[/b].

Pickles was based on "real life dog that found the missing Rimet Cup":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pickles_(dog)].

The translator Pickles use are voiced by [[Saito Soma]], while the English voice actor are yet to be revealed...

h4. Appearance
* !post #6815641: Default
* !post #6815645: Insight II: An Indigo Fluff
* !post #6828489: The Young Dog and The Sea

title: kakei_sumire
body:
A character originally introduced in the [[Boruto: Naruto Next Generations|Boruto]] anime, before she formally debuted in the manga. She was the class representative in Boruto's class, with a mostly purple color scheme and wore her hair in a long single braid.

She openly admits to liking [[Uzumaki Boruto]], which puts her opposite to [[Uchiha Sarada]]'s more subdued attraction.

body:
Main protagonist of [[Don Quixote (novel)|]].

[b]Alonso Quijano[/b], also known as [b]Alonso Quixano[/b], [b]Don Quijote[/b] or [b]Don Quixote[/b], is an Hidalgo (member of the lowest nobility) from the [[spain|Spanish]] reign of La Mancha who reads so many chivalric romances that he [[crazy|loses his mind]] and decides to become a [[knight]]-errant ([i]caballero andante[/i]) to revive [[chivalry]] and serve his nation and his kingdom.

He is a very tall and skinny middle age [[beard]]ed man who wears a rusty [[armor]] and wields a twisted [[sword]]. He is often depicted wearing a [[basin|shaving basin]] as a makeshift helmet.

h4. Derivative characters

* [[Don Quixote (FATE)]]
* [[Don Quixote (Project MOON)]]

title: nanatsu-yoru
body:
[[Tohno Shiki]]'s main weapon in [[Tsukihime]] , whose name translates to [b]Seven Nights[/b]. An antique knife inscribed with the name of the Nanaya clan, and later given to Shiki. 

It is a switchblade with a plain hilt, with its blade and hilt of a length around 10cm. The blade can alternately be called [b]the Nanaya[/b].

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Shiki Tohno":[https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Shiki_Tohno]

title: elio_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A character from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Leader of the Stellaron Hunters, known as "Destiny's Slave".

Has yet to be confirmed in-game, though a humanoid form has possibly been leaked, and a popular fan theory holds him to be the black cat seen in Kafka's CG (post #5616455), as well as other official arts featuring the Stellaron Hunters (post #7050819, post #7145868, post #9068092).

title: cecily_fairchild
body:

[spoiler] Her true identity is in fact [[Berah Ronah]], heir to the [[Crossbone Vanguard]] and daughter of [[Carozzo Ronah]], a.k.a. Iron Mask.[/spoiler]

title: okita_sougo
body:
A character in [[Gintama]], modeled after [[Okita Souji]].

He's the best swordsman in the [[shinsengumi_(gintama)|Shinsengumi]]. Although he is a master of kenjutsu, he frequently uses a bazooka. He tends to be light-hearted and somewhat childish, though his speech is heavily deadpan.

In comparison to [[Hijikata Toushirou|Hijikata]], Okita is very lazy when it comes to his job as he is often seen taking naps when he is supposed to work. He is also known as a sadist, being highly skilled in torturing people.

title: celica_(xenoblade_x)
body:
Character in [[Xenoblade Chronicles X]].

A Qlurian, an [[elf]]-like alien species. Together with her friend [[Rock (xenoblade x)|]], she is on the run from the Ganglion, but is found and granted asylum by the humans of NLA. She later becomes a member of BLADE and can join the party.
